programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Right on the Money
programme.desc: Dominic Littlewood and Denise Lewis help an 81-year-old woman struggling to juggle the family finances while caring for her husband, who is suffering from dementia.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore properties sold at auction, including a three-bedroom house in Streatham, south London, which was bought by a recently married couple.(n)

programme.title: Neighbourhood Blues
programme.desc: Rob McIvor investigates after art galleries in Bath are inundated with Nazi-themed hate mail, and police in Bridgwater carry out an early morning raid in a quiet residential street.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Holidays
programme.desc: Angela Rippon, Gloria Hunniford and Julia Somerville report on the cleanliness of British hotel rooms, while travel expert Simon Calder has money-saving tips for visiting America.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents from Newark, with experts Charles Hanson and Philip Serrell, while Charlie pops into town and pays a visit to the Civil War centre.(n)

programme.title: Red Rock
programme.desc: New series. A killer is still at large, but the investigators lack leads, the Kielys mark the anniversary of Darren's death and Claire is unaware of the danger an intruder poses.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson heads to the Welsh borders to help a couple who want their £750,000 budget to provide them a country home with potential to become a B&B business. The presenter also discovers how the region's iron works heritage is being recast into unique super-sized sculptures.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: At the tip, Sarah Moore prevents a sewage pipe, a blanket box and a cardboard box full of old plates from being dumped to landfill, transforming them into bespoke and valuable pieces. Back in Stockport, she reveals the transformations and hands over the profits to the people who had no idea that riches could be made from their rubbish.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: People are invited to try to make money out of their antiques by taking a risk at auction.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys puts another selection of famous faces through their general-knowledge paces. Taking a seat in the black chair are CBBC's Lauren Layfield, who answers questions on the Jurassic Park films, broadcaster and journalist David Aaronovitch, who tackles Radio 4 soap The Archers, BBC Breakfast's Tim Muffett demonstrates his knowledge of the Films of Danny Boyle trivia, and Paralympic gold medallist Kadeena Cox faces questions about Arsenal FC.(n)

programme.title: True North
programme.desc: The Donnelly family from rural County Armagh are thought to be the oldest group of siblings in the world. Collectively their ages add up to 1,064 years. Angela Scanlon meets them as they attempt to get a world record. Part of BBC One's Our Lives strand.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Steven avoids Lauren's obvious concerns following his shocking news and assures her everything will be fine - but when Abi learns about his lie she warns him to tell the truth. Ian celebrates accepting an offer on the fish-and-chip shop, although his excitement fades when he realises who bought it. Sonia is surprised to hear Dot is coming home despite the doctor's advice, while Alexandra and Keegan plan to cause havoc at the prom.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Donald Trump fought the US presidential election with a promise to send millions of illegal immigrants back to Mexico and this programme investigates how his controversial deportation plans are being put into action. Reporter Hilary Andersson meets families split by immigration arrests as well as children of detained parents left to fend for themselves, and accompanies police in Arizona as they hunt down illegals at night.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: The Big Build: Swansea.
programme.desc: Nick Knowles travels to Swansea to meet 15-year-old Jack, who suffers from a rare form of muscular dystrophy that has led to a lifetime of painful operations. His mother Helen and older brother Daniel do all they can to help but as he grows it has become impossible to get him upstairs and now he has to sleep in the living room, leaving the rest of the family with nowhere to socialise. Having heard of their plight, the DIY SOS team turns up to transform their three-bedroom semi, backed up by an army of local tradespeople, with designer Gabrielle Blackman on hand to ensure they don't stray too far from her vision.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kay's Comedy Shuffle
programme.desc: The comedian, actor, writer and director looks back on his eventful career, shining a light on dieting. Plus, Car Share's John and Kayleigh are both in tears, and there's a special appearance by veteran snooker player Dennis Taylor.(n)

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News For You.
programme.desc: Actor Stephen Mangan hosts an extended edition of the satirical current affairs quiz, with Scottish Convervatives leader Ruth Davidson MSP and comedian Henning Wehn joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's news.(n)

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are
programme.desc: Choreographer and Strictly judge Craig Revel Horwood becomes the latest celebrity to dig into his family's past in the popular genealogy show. Having lived and worked in Britain for the past 26 years, he now returns to his native Australia, curious to know if anyone else in the family was also involved in showbusiness. He discovers that one ancestor risked everything in the Australian gold rush, before a visit to his 100-year-old grandmother puts him on the trail of another maverick relative, who was the life and soul of the party. Sound like anyone we know?.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Right on the Money
programme.desc: Denise Lewis and Dominic Littlewood give advice on how to save money on holidays and days out, while the team helps a teacher trying to build a better life for her young twins.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore properties about to be auctioned in Cornwall, London and Kent, before finding out about the new owners' plans for the buildings.(n)

programme.title: Neighbourhood Blues
programme.desc: Officer Dom Bryant gets an anonymous tip-off that cannabis is being grown at a house in the small village of Burnham-on-Sea, but he finds out that all is not what it seems.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Holidays
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Angela Rippon and Julia Somerville investigate health-related holiday disasters, and couples left out of pocket because of cancelled breaks due to the zika virus.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin takes the bargain hunting teams to Leominster, Herefordshire, where two teams compete to buy three items that will hopefully make the greater profit at auction. Providing a helping hand to the sides are experts Paul Laidlaw and Mark Ashley. Plus, Natasha meets Royal Worcester aficionado Henry Sandon.(n)

programme.title: Red Rock
programme.desc: Paudge's blackmail ordeal may finally be over, Garda officers pursue a new murder suspect, and the Kielys `welcome' Hennessy visitors.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman heads to Somerset to help a woman find a home in the countryside for her and her elderly mother with a £375,000 budget. While there, the presenter meets a fashion entrepreneur turned horticulturalist, who has designs on an iconic Somerset garden.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore hopes to turn some old manhole covers, two forlorn seats and an antique suit stand into hard cash after rescuing them from a Surrey tip.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: A collection of some of the best, unseen finds from the series, visiting the Milestones Museum in Basingstoke Ragley Hall in Warwickshire, the National Maritime Museum Cornwall in Falmouth, and the RAF museum in Hendon, London. Items include an art nouveau necklace and a pair of British railway lamps.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys quizzes another four famous faces on their specialist subjects. Those braving the black chair are comedian Mitch Benn, news presenter Reeta Chakrabarti, CBBC's Mark Rhodes and triathlon gold medallist Alistair Brownlee, showing what they know about Peter Cook, the life and poetry of John Keats, the World Wrestling Federation and the Yorkshire Dales.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Lauren opens up to Max about Steven's news, leaving her suspicious father doing a little digging in an attempt to get to the bottom of what's going on. But will he discover the truth? Max also pays a visit to Ian after hearing he has pulled out of the sale of the chip shop. Robbie nervously awaits a visit from his boss, while Kush encourages Shakil to invite Bex to the prom.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Essie worries that she is not being a good foster parent to Parker, but determined to take all the responsibility herself, she is reluctant to accept any help from Raf. Meanwhile, a tricky patient diagnosis throws Morven straight in at the deep end on her first day back, and Matteo recruits an unenthusiastic Jac to work with Damon on his assessment day.(n)

programme.title: In the Dark
programme.desc: Helen and Paul are joined by pathologist friend Phil Hendricks as they become further embroiled in the abduction case. The clock is ticking to find Poppy alive and clear Bates's name, but to Paul's vexation, Helen seems increasingly disturbed by being in Polesford. Is she too distracted by pressing secrets past and present to keep her mind on the case? Crime drama, starring MyAnna Buring and Ben Batt.(n)

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: In a special edition of the detective drama that features only two members of the team, Gerry Standing and Steve McAndrew travel to Glasgow, where a new Ucos section is being set up. While there, they agree to assist the investigation into the 1993 unsolved murder of James Soutar, the wealthy owner of a string of betting shops. Cathy Sinclair, one of the beneficiaries of the bookie's will at his death, had a care-home upbringing in common with Soutar, but she claims to have no idea who he was or why she was left £15,000. McAndrew has a personal stake in the case - the original investigating officer was corrupt cop Frank McNair, who had an affair with his wife, and their paths soon cross. The London-based officers' questions begin to unsettle someone and a campaign of victimisation against them begins, but it's a revelation from McAndrew's girlfriend Charley that reawakens a long-dormant scandal and clears the path to a solution. Dennis Waterman and Denis Lawson star.(n)

programme.title: True North
programme.desc: The Donnelly family from rural County Armagh are thought to be the oldest group of siblings in the world. Collectively their ages add up to 1,064 years. Angela Scanlon meets them as they attempt to get a world record. Part of BBC One's Our Lives strand.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Entrepreneur Duncan Bannatyne joins host Brian Conley for a nostalgic look at the archive television shows that helped set him on the path to business success, with selections including Take Your Pick and Coronation Street.(n)

programme.title: Right on the Money
programme.desc: Denise Lewis and Dominic Littlewood help a hard-working nurse who has to rely on the bank of mum and dad, despite working full-time.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles is joined in York by experts Nick Hall and Jonathan Pratt. The reds and blue teams have the choice of two antique centres to buy three items to take to auction in Darlington. Eric also finds out about the city's long association with confectionery at its Castle Museum.(n)

programme.title: Alone with the In-Laws
programme.desc: Chris and Stacey from Bristol are getting married in the summer, and while planning for the big day is one thing, making a success of the years that follow is another. To help out, the Rev Kate Bottley comes up with an idea - they will spend a few days living alone with their respective in-laws-to-be, to find out what they can learn about each other from the people who raised them. After four days, will the couple still feel the same about trying the knot?.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and reports from correspondents around the country. Presented by Jo Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Athletics
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents action from the 10th Diamond League event of the season, held at Prince Moulay Abdellah Stadium in Rabat, Morocco.(n)

programme.title: Triathlon
programme.desc: Action from the men's and women's races in the fifth round of the ITU World Triathlon Series, which took place in Hamburg, Germany.(n)

programme.title: Secrets of Our Living Planet
programme.desc: Chris Packham embarks on a quest to highlight some of the most diverse ecosystems on the planet. Along the way, he details the intricate - and often unexpected - connections between various species that thrive in symbiosis, and showcases the habitats that make life on Earth possible. He begins by exploring the web of life sustained by one of the mightiest trees in the Amazon, and the tiny rodent it relies upon for survival.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antiques experts Charles Hanson and Christina Trevanion set off on a trip around Britain seeking out bargains they hope will make a profit at auction. They begin their journey in Whaley Bridge, Derbyshire, before heading to an auction in Liverpool.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Letterbox
programme.desc: New series. Game show hosted by Mel Giedroyc, as pairs of contestants go head-to-head to crack a series of passwords, in an attempt to take home £2,500 in cash. As the teams solve the passwords, they win letters that will help them later in the game, giving them a better chance of cracking the final password which unlocks the Letterbox holding the cash prize. However, if they end up as the losing pair along the way, they'll have to surrender all the letters they've won to the winning pair - who will then go through to the semi-final eliminator round.(n)

programme.title: Paul Hollywood's Big Continental Road Trip
programme.desc: New series. The Bake Off judge takes a series of road trips across different countries in Europe, driving some of the most famous cars made in each nation he visits. The first episode comes from Italy, where Paul takes a six-day journey with a different car for each day, beginning in Rome where he is joined by Strictly Come Dancing's Bruno Tonioli.(n)

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: Jeremy Paxman asks the questions once again as the academic quiz returns for its 24th series since the revival of the show in 1994. The opening match of the first round sees the University of Edinburgh and Ulster University battle it out for a place in the second stage of the contest.(n)

programme.title: Nadiya's British Food Adventure
programme.desc: The Great British Bake Off 2015 champion Nadiya Hussain embarks on a culinary road trip around Britain, meeting with producers, farmers and fishermen across the country as she creates her own recipes inspired by their produce. In the first episode Nadiya begins her tour in the Home Counties, where she visits an asparagus farm in Oxford, before trying her hand at food smoking in Milton Keynes.(n)

programme.title: Ripper Street
programme.desc: With Reid locked in the cells of Leman Street and Jedediah Shine dead, Dove and his protege Drummond try to track down Long Susan and Jackson and bring them to justice. However, having finally retrieved their son Connor, Long Susan and Jackson prepare to leave London for good - but can they bring themselves to leave their friend Reid behind?.(n)

programme.title: Normal for Norfolk
programme.desc: New series. The continuing travails of farmer Desmond MacCarthy as he attempts to keep his 17th-century manor house afloat and stay on the right side of bankruptcy. Now, hundreds of thousands of pounds in debt and with his overdraft at its limit, Desmond must conjure up increasingly clever ways to make money if he's to survive. The Wiveton cafe is beginning to thrive, but profits are devoured by the maintenance of the house and gardens. Desmond, with the help of his loyal team, begins to promote the Edwardian wing of Wiveton Hall as a place to stay and takes a booking from an international yoga retreat.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: Over the past two years, the staff of the Natural History Museum has undertaken a super-sized challenge - to take down its famous cast of a dinosaur skeleton in the entrance hall and replace it with an equally impressive skeleton of a blue whale - the largest animal to have lived. This documentary follows the teams of conservators and engineers as they take apart the diplodocus - known to staff and visitors as Dippy - bone by bone, ready for a countrywide tour and then get the whale ready to go on display - all without closing the museum to the public. Narrated by David Attenborough.(n)

programme.title: Eat Well for Less
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace and Chris Bavin help the Brook family from Nottingham lower their food bills, and show them ways to follow a healthier diet while saving money on their weekly shop. Daughters Rosie and Sophia prefer snacking on sugary treats than following a healthy, balanced diet, and their fussy eating habits mean Mum Janine is forced to cook separate meals for the family each night.(n)

programme.title: Supermarket Secrets
programme.desc: A look at how the retailers compete in the market for healthier foods. Gregg Wallace discovers how one supermarket is using an exotic ingredient to reduce salt in burgers and heads to Germany to find out whether a new innovation could deliver alcohol-free wine that still tastes good. Babita Sharma investigates the technology required to create a wheat and dairy-free version of one of the nation's favourite dishes and gets to the bottom of the confusing world of health labelling.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Swimmer Rebecca Adlington joins comedy entertainer Brian Conley for a nostalgic look at the archive television programmes that helped set her on the path to Olympic success. Her selections include Fawlty Towers, Blind Date and Art Attack.(n)

programme.title: Right on the Money
programme.desc: Dominic Littlewood and Denise Lewis help an 81-year-old woman struggling to juggle the family finances while caring for her husband, who is suffering from dementia.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents from Newark, with experts Charles Hanson and Philip Serrell, while Charlie pops into town and pays a visit to the Civil War centre.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: The team helps a couple whose 24-year-old son Ryan has been living in hospital for the last five years, as they renovate the downstairs of their three-bedroom house in Bristol so he can move back home. The house needs a downstairs extension with all the bespoke care provision that Ryan will need, including physio space, a wet-room, a family area and the ability to access the entire ground floor, and if the family doesn't get this work done, Ryan will remain in hospital 50 miles away.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country. Presented by Jo Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman presents the quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: The Super League Show
programme.desc: Tanya Arnold introduces action from the latest top-flight matches, including Wigan Warriors v Warrington Wolves, Leeds Rhinos v Hull FC and Castleford Tigers v Salford Red Devils.(n)

programme.title: Chronicles of a Champion Golfer
programme.sub-title: Tiger Woods, Tom Watson and Jack Nicklaus.
programme.desc: A look at how Tiger Woods, Tom Watson and Jack Nicklaus have fared at The Open, featuring first-person accounts from the trio, as they recount their famous victories.(n)

programme.title: Nature's Miracle Babies
programme.desc: Martin Hughes-Games explores the ground-breaking work being done by breeding programmes protecting some of the most threatened animals. He begins in China with the giant panda - which is being helped to become pregnant using medical techniques developed for humans. Martin also visits programmes in Jersey and Whipsnade Zoo aiming to protect the futures of the pied tamarin monkey, at risk from deforestation in Brazil, and the one-horned rhino.(n)

programme.title: Secrets of Our Living Planet
programme.desc: Chris Packham reveals the ways in which animals help balance the ecosystem and contribute towards the survival of the world's plains. He investigates how white rhinos in Kenya create essential nitrogen hotspots by trimming and fertilising grass, how fruit-eating maned wolves control the Brazilian Cerrado, discovers the Australian Outback is managed by rat kangaroos and bandicoots, and learns that termites are a worldwide source of protein.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Experts Charles Hanson and Christina Trevanion begin the second leg of their trip in Manchester, hoping to find bargains that will make a profit at auction, before making their way to Birkenhead, on the Wirral. Narrated by Tim Wonnacott.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Letterbox
programme.desc: Game show hosted by Mel Giedroyc, as pairs of contestants go head-to-head to crack a series of passwords, in an attempt to take home £2,500 in cash.(n)

programme.title: Paul Hollywood's Big Continental Road Trip
programme.desc: Paul spends six days exploring Germany in six different cars. After getting used to German driving on the streets of Berlin, he visits a Cold War checkpoint and a nudist colony, and pits cars made in the 1970s on either side of the Berlin Wall against each other. The trip ends at the Nurburgring racetrack, where he is joined by comedian Al Murray.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: New series. Gregg Wallace, Cherry Healey and Ruth Goodman investigate the origins and production of more household staples, beginning with tea. Gregg looks at the factory that produces one quarter of all the tea drunk in Britain. Meanwhile, Cherry Healey examines an African tea processing plant, and Ruth Goodman sheds light on how Second World War troops risked their lives to brew up.(n)

programme.title: Addicted Parents: Last Chance to Keep My Children
programme.desc: Part one of a two-part documentary following a year in a rehab centre for parents struggling with addictions, who are given six months to prove they can stay clean and look after their children. The first episode follows four mothers as they go through a detox treatment and reflect on the factors that have led to their addiction and the impact it has had on their children.(n)

programme.title: Detectorists
programme.desc: Russell and Hugh embark on their mission to recover the mayor's chain of office from the car park in Barnfather Woods. Sophie proves she's still very bad at spying, while Becky and Lance each have something important to tell Andy. Comedy, starring Mackenzie Crook, Toby Jones, Aimee-Ffion Edwards and Rachael Stirling.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: 1066: A Year to Conquer England
programme.desc: Docudrama in which Dan Snow explores the political intrigues and family betrayals between Vikings, Anglo-Saxons and Normans that led to the Battle of Hastings. The first edition reveals how the death of Edward the Confessor without an heir triggered a bitter race to succeed him as king of England, with Earl Harold successfully taking the crown. However, William of Normandy believes the throne has been promised to him and decides to invade, while Viking king Harald Hardrada also fancies himself as monarch.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: Handmade: By Royal Appointment
programme.desc: In a small workshop in a country house in Wiltshire, silversmith Simon Benney makes distinctive jewellery and household objects for the royal family and private clients. Simon is following in the footsteps of his father, Gerald, who revolutionised the design of British silverware in the post-war era. This film follows the making of an engraved, gold and diamond pendant by Simon, featuring a trademark enamel finish using techniques his father learnt from Faberge.(n)

programme.title: Colour: The Spectrum of Science
programme.desc: Dr Helen Czerski tells the story of scientific endeavour, revealing the secrets of the universe as she takes to the skies in a jumbo jet, equipped with an infra-red telescope. She explores how the birds and the bees, who can see ultraviolet, view the world, and looks at how x-rays can be used to harness colours and image the human body as never before, thereby opening up new ways to treat disease. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Science and Islam
programme.desc: Professor Jim Al-Khalili reveals how Polish astronomer Nicolaus Copernicus's theories about the Earth's orbit were shaped by the discoveries of Islamic scientists. He travels to Syria to observe Ibn Al-Shatir's sundial on the minaret of the Umayyad Mosque in Damascus, before visiting one of the most influential observatories of the Islamic world, Maragheh designed by Al-Tusi. He ends his journey at the Royan Institute in Iran, to investigate how science is now regarded in Islam. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Storyville
programme.sub-title: Storyville: The Great European Cigarette Mystery.
programme.desc: An investigation into John Dalli, the former EU Commissioner of Health, who recently left his post having been accused of being in the pocket of the big tobacco companies. Two Danish journalists Mads Brugger and Mikael Bertelsen travel to Malta expecting to uncover proof of a vast conspiracy against Dalli, when a secret source steps forward, claiming to possess documents and recordings, taking them on a disturbing, thrilling and darkly humorous odyssey from the hallways of Brussels to an island in the Caribbean Sea.(n)

programme.title: Hidden Kingdoms
programme.desc: The documentary focuses on small creatures in an urban setting. In Rio de Janeiro, marmosets use power-lines as they would tree branches to scour the streets for food, and one animal becomes separated from its group and is forced to the ground, where it confronts the dangers of the city alone. Almost 11,000 miles away in the neon metropolis of Tokyo, a rhinoceros beetle begins an extraordinary journey to find sanctuary on a rare patch of greenery, along the way facing predatory bats, eight-eyed jumping spiders, praying mantises and a sharp-eyed crow. Including Hidden Kingdoms Revealed, showing how the film was made. Narrated by Stephen Fry. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Ocean Giants
programme.desc: The documentary explores the intelligence of marine mammals, discovering just how smart whales and dolphins really are. Scientist Denise Herzing talks about the development of a two-way communication system between dolphins and humans in the Bahamas, while in Western Australia the creatures are filmed using a range of survival skills. In Mexico, grey whales seemingly empathise with humans, while the humpbacks of Alaska pool their talents to increase hunting success. Narrated by Stephen Fry.(n)

programme.title: Treasures of Chinese Porcelain
programme.desc: Lars Tharp explores the enduring popularity of Chinese porcelain in European auction houses, and investigates why demand for such items rose dramatically in the 18th century. He visits Mount Gaolin, where many of the most popular pieces began life, to discover how items such as vases and crockery are manufactured, before heading to the city of Jingdezhen, the centre of the country's porcelain trade. Lars also examines the ways in which demand for certain designs influenced aesthetic tastes in both Europe and China.(n)

programme.title: Science and Islam
programme.desc: Professor Jim Al-Khalili reveals how Polish astronomer Nicolaus Copernicus's theories about the Earth's orbit were shaped by the discoveries of Islamic scientists. He travels to Syria to observe Ibn Al-Shatir's sundial on the minaret of the Umayyad Mosque in Damascus, before visiting one of the most influential observatories of the Islamic world, Maragheh designed by Al-Tusi. He ends his journey at the Royan Institute in Iran, to investigate how science is now regarded in Islam. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Colour: The Spectrum of Science
programme.desc: Dr Helen Czerski tells the story of scientific endeavour, revealing the secrets of the universe as she takes to the skies in a jumbo jet, equipped with an infra-red telescope. She explores how the birds and the bees, who can see ultraviolet, view the world, and looks at how x-rays can be used to harness colours and image the human body as never before, thereby opening up new ways to treat disease. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: Handmade: By Royal Appointment
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of the craftspeople behind the making, maintenance and restoration of Steinway pianos, from the German factory workers bending the frames and polishing the veneers to longstanding British restorer Jeff about to retire from the company. Steinway supplies pianos to the royal household as well as many leading performers, and the film goes behind the scenes as renowned pianist Lang Lang prepares for a concert at the Royal Albert Hall. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: 10 Things You Didn't Know About
programme.sub-title: 10 Things You Didn't Know About Earthquakes.
programme.desc: Iain Stewart investigates some of the world's most destructive and devastating seismic activity, examining what makes earthquakes so difficult to predict or prevent. He also reveals why these powerful forces of nature can last up to 60 times longer on the surface of the moon than on Earth.(n)

programme.title: A Timewatch Guide
programme.sub-title: The Vikings: Foe or Friend? A Timewatch Guide.
programme.desc: In the year 793, Europe changed for ever when the famous monastery at Lindisfarne on the Northumbrian coast was suddenly attacked and looted by seafaring Scandinavians. Alice Roberts examines how the story of the Vikings has been portrayed on TV since the 1960s. She investigates how the focus has shifted from viewing them as brutal barbarians to pioneering traders, able to integrate into multiple cultures. She also considers how their huge trading empire spread and their surprising legacy in the modern world.(n)

programme.title: Secret Knowledge
programme.sub-title: Secret Knowledge: The Art of the Vikings.
programme.desc: Janina Ramirez explores the long-lasting effects of Viking culture on the British Isles through interpretations of a selection of archaeological items from the Swedish National Museum, which are now on display in Edinburgh.(n)

programme.title: Treasures of the Anglo-Saxons
programme.desc: Historian Dr Janina Ramirez investigates the development of Anglo-Saxon art. Examining the Sutton Hoo treasures the Franks Casket, the Staffordshire Hoard and the Lindisfarne Gospels, she uncovers the secret codes and symbols that reveal the pagan past and Christian future of the Anglo-Saxon people, and discusses how their artistic development was brought to an end by the Norman invasion of 1066.(n)

programme.title: World War Two: 1942 and Hitler's Soft Underbelly
programme.desc: David Reynolds explores the reasoning behind the Second World War battles that took place in North Africa and Italy - an area labelled Hitler's `soft underbelly' by Winston Churchill. Through his investigation, Reynolds discovers a prime minister who was politically vulnerable at home, desperate to shore up a crumbling British empire abroad and even ready to deceive his American allies. The programme marks the 70th anniversary of the Battle of El Alamein in 1942.(n)

programme.desc: An old friend of Ben's visits Virginia City with his acrobatic troupe. Western drama series, following the adventures of the Cartwright family.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A petty officer is killed while competing in a swimsuit contest, raising fears she may have fallen victim to a jealous rival, or even a stalker. Gibbs' investigation leads to the discovery that the victim was taking yoga classes - and this provides him with the breakthrough he needs to solve the case. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A traumatised marine escapes from a psychiatric unit, convinced he is still fighting in Iraq. The agents believe his erratic behaviour indicates post-traumatic stress disorder and try to calmly talk him round before restraining him. However, blood tests reveal high levels of steroids in his system - meaning someone is using him as a human lab rat. Starring Lauren Holly, Sean Murray and Cote de Pablo.(n)

programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger
programme.desc: Alex takes on a gang of arsonists who try to murder the firefighters called out to extinguish their fires.(n)

programme.title: JAG
programme.desc: A soldier's remains are discovered and the team sets out on a mission to learn his identity. General Cresswell's brother suspects the dead man was a Vietnamese pilot who saved his life during the war, so a search begins among his relatives for a DNA match.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Marine Brandon Valdivia falls to his death from a rooftop bar and is initially thought to have committed suicide, but his family refuse to accept that possibility and persuade a congressman to put some pressure on the admiral. Sam and Callen are then brought in to re-evaluate the case and discover that Valdivia may have been involved in money laundering with a fellow marine.(n)

programme.title: Diagnosis Murder

programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A Muslim US Marine is found seemingly shot dead near a mosque that has been linked to an al-Qaeda recruiter. Ducky refuses to perform an autopsy out of respect for the man's religion, but Abby runs tests that reveal his demise was actually due to poisoning from a rare octopus venom. Meanwhile, McGee goes into the mosque intending to plant a concealed microphone - but discovers someone has had the same idea.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: An officer is found dead, and evidence initially suggests she committed suicide as a result of a nervous breakdown. However, a sceptical Ducky believes foul play was involved - and the team later discovers the victim was caught up in a love triangle. Kevin Quigley guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Ultimate Force
programme.desc: After Red Troop and Special Branch foil a drug gang's deal with Dutch criminals, their leader hijacks a London tourist bus and loads it with guns and hostages. programme.title: 3rd Rock from the Sun
programme.desc: The four aliens land on Earth and assume human forms, and Dick soon finds himself attracted to a college professor with whom he shares an office. First-ever episode of the award-winning comedy, starring John Lithgow, Joseph Gordon-Levitt, Kristen Johnston and French Stewart.(n)

programme.title: 3rd Rock from the Sun
programme.desc: The aliens catch a cold from Tommy, just as Dick is about to escort Dr Albright to a wedding. Sci-fi comedy, guest starring Martha Stewart, with John Lithgow, Jane Curtin and Joseph Gordon-Levitt.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Will takes Karen to see one of the best doctors in the city after she misses her check-up, while Jack flirts with a male nurse - and the idea of becoming one himself. Guest starring Jack Black.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Karen lets Jack skip nursing school, and Grace returns to New York to celebrate her mother's birthday - to the delight of Will, who tries to persuade her to stay longer.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Frank has some anecdotes published in a magazine, sowing the seeds of grand writing ambitions. He approaches Ray's editor about becoming a columnist, but finds his way with words leaves a lot to be desired. Comedy, starring Peter Boyle.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Marie decides 40 years of marriage to Frank is enough for any woman and moves in with Ray - to the delight of Robert, who enjoys being mothered by her. Debra is unhappy with the situation and tries to persuade her father-in-law to apologise, but he is enjoying the single life too much to agree.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Martin suffers a mild heart attack, but tries to keep it from Ronee - to the dismay of Frasier and Niles, who feel it would be unfair of him to hide such serious news. Eventually worn down by their persistence, he decides to confide in her - leading to a conversation that ends in an unexpected way.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Infuriated at the dullness of his life, Frasier steals a small box from a neighbour for the thrill, but guilt prompts him to look for a way to return it without being caught - a task that proves easier said than done. With the guest voice of Helen Mirren.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles and Daphne plan a natural birth, causing the father-to-be to develop sympathy pains. Meanwhile, Frasier hires a professional matchmaker - but ends up going on a string of bad dates. Guest starring Laura Linney.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Shane Evans, COO and co-founder of massage therapy chain Massage Heights, poses as a contestant on a TV reality show who is trying fund her own business. After spending nine years moulding the company, she decides to find out first-hand how her retreats are doing so she can fix potential problems before expanding the business to 300 new locations.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Roberta Smithies from the Lake District in Cumbria hopes to wave goodbye to her childhood home and embrace a new life in Costa Rica. She has a budget of £200,000 and hopes Jonnie Irwin will find her a property with views that are impressive enough to tempt her to make an offer.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples from the north Kent coast compete, with engaged Emma and Craig kicking things off with their menu of simple fare, but the starter isn't popular and there are issues with the dessert. Darren and Dan are next up and their food goes down a storm, while well-to-do Edward and Catherine conclude proceedings, hoping to impress with their grand house and fine dining. Who will take home the £1,000 prize money?.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Pickwick Pawnbrokers boss Nathan might have laid his hands on a fourth-century statue worth tens of thousands of pounds, while another customer is selling a rare grandfather clock.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with historian and broadcaster Suzannah Lipscomb in Dictionary Corner alongside Susie Dent.(n)

programme.title: The Question Jury
programme.desc: New series. Quiz in which seven contestants are locked in a jury room and must work together to answer questions correctly and accumulate as much money as possible.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman tries to help Dave and Debbie Gough from Swindon, who have been holidaying on the Costa Blanca for 30 years and now want to retire there.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at the White Lodge Hotel in Filey, North Yorkshire, where hosts James and Kim Hodgson hope their love of high standards will win over their guests.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Charity support worker Sebastian is the first host in a week of parties from in and around Sheffield, and he hopes to charm his guests with his winning smile and great conversation.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Principal Skinner uses his Counter Truancy Unit to thwart a possible terror attack at Springfield Elementary's Annual Bake Sale. Rogue agent Bart could be the only hope of stopping the plot - until he clashes with Jack Bauer, who is on an important mission of his own. With the voices of 24's Kiefer Sutherland and Mary-Lynn Rajskub.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Armstrong convinces Cindy to do a talk about powerful women in Liverpool, and Leela tries to warn Cindy about Armstrong. Meanwhile, Scott goes searching for his brother, Simone is bonding with baby Daniel, and Marnie gets a blast from her past.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.sub-title: World Para Athletics Championships London 2017: Day Four.
programme.desc: Sophie Morgan, Ade Adepitan and Lee McKenzie present coverage of the evening session on day four of the Championships, which takes place at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park. A number of gold medals are set to be awarded tonight, including the men's T42 100m, T36 200m, T54 800m and T44 long jump, as well as the women's T34 800m and T44 100m. With expert analysis from Jonnie Peacock, David Weir and Greg Rutherford.(n)

programme.title: Is Love Racist? The Dating Game
programme.desc: Sociologist and broadcaster Emma Dabiri looks at racism in Britain through the world of modern dating, unveiling the results of a national survey of British online dating habits. A volunteer group of young British singletons take part in a series of experiments to discover if there's more than meets the eye going on in the flighty world of modern dating apps. Emma also meets a number of controversial interviewees - from Mobo-award-winning rapper Nadia Rose, through to BAME equal opportunities campaigner Baroness McGregor-Smith.(n)

programme.title: 60 Days in Jail
programme.desc: Three new participants enter the programme, while the others fight for acceptance in their pods and one participant is dragged into a confrontation that quickly turns physical.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Benefit Tenants
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of specialist letting agencies. Manchester agent Joe is caught between a single mother struggling to pay off her rent arrears and a landlord who has run out of patience. But unknown to Joe, his tenant has a plan to get herself out of this mess she has found herself in. Across town, letting agent Tracy is in for a shock when she discovers one of her tenants has turned a bedroom into an aviary full of tropical birds.(n)

programme.title: Who Wants My Council House
programme.desc: Documentary following five households looking to swap their council house. Some want to upgrade to their ideal home, others simply fancy a change of scenery and some are parents seeking to downsize now that their children have flown the nest. However, council house swaps do not involve estate agents with sharp sales patter. It is up to the tenants to show each other around their homes and do the hard sell. If the first viewing goes well, there will be an invitation for a return viewing before both sides decide whether to swap - or not.(n)

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Find Me a Home
programme.desc: Phil tries to help two families who have been made homeless, but is shocked by the terrible housing conditions so many people are forced to endure. Corvel and Meyrem are a hard-working couple from Southwark in London, who are being evicted from their one-bedroom cockroach and rat-infested flat, while Bibi and her 15-year-old son Oscar were evicted from the home they'd lived in for 15 years and have hit a brick wall when it comes to finding a new place.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A five-year-old Great Dane is rushed to Fitzpatrick Referrals after losing the use of its back legs due to a slipped disc, with complications leaving the dog fighting for its life. A woman and her two children bring their pet spaniel to the practice after it is hit by a car, and a 10-year-old collie with hip dysplasia visits the surgery.(n)

programme.title: Supershoppers
programme.desc: The team investigates big-brand baby foods and finds some unexpected ingredients, while Fairy Original's longer-lasting claim is put to the test. Anna Richardson and Andi Osho check out if readers' offers are really as good as they sound and look into the high street in-store experiences that tempt us to spend again.(n)

programme.title: Tried and Tasted: The Ultimate Shopping List
programme.desc: Chef Michel Roux Jr and a panel of food experts blind taste-test some of the nation's favourite food and drink. Joining the host is restaurant manager and First Dates' Fred Sirieix, journalist, broadcaster and critic Jay Rayner, baker and deli owner Stacie Stewart, and TV presenter and foodie mum Lucy Alexander. The panel this week choose between four different brands of steak and ale pie, houmous and sauvignon blanc - the UK's most popular wine. Plus, the quick-fire public test is for cola drinks.(n)

programme.title: Shipping Wars UK
programme.desc: Laurie takes 10 golf buggies to Blenheim Palace in Oxfordshire, while Jemma undertakes her first solo delivery as she transports two bars to a foodie festival in south London.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help a couple with a budget of £480,000, who are expecting a baby in 12 weeks, find a home in Godalming, on Surrey's commuter belt, as quickly as possible. The property gurus also come to the aid of a fastidious pair in Guildford who are struggling to find a home for £250,000, jeopardising their marriage plans in the process.(n)

programme.title: Countdown

programme.desc: Ray ignores Frank's advice and loses all his cash in a poker game. Debra urges him to ask for the money back, but he is too proud to beg his father for help. Comedy, starring Ray Romano.(n)

He poses as a reality TV contestant who is trying to win funds to start up his own business, before revealing his true identity and offering rewards to some of the memorable people he has met.(n)

programme.title: When Football Banned Women
programme.desc: Clare Balding uncovers the hidden history of women's football. A hundred years ago, the women's game dominated the headlines and attracted crowds of up to 60,000. The star players everyone wanted to see were teenage striker Lily Parr and her teammate Alice Woods, and the most popular team in England was Dick, Kerr's Ladies. Clare reveals how women's football teams grew out of munitions factories during the First World War where women had replaced men sent into battle. It also uncovers an untold chapter in the fight for equality waged at a time when women ruled the pitch.(n)

programme.desc: In November 1983, Dennis Nilsen was sentenced at the Old Bailey to life imprisonment for killing six men and the attempted murders of two others. This docu-drama examines the events that led him to become a serial killer, using witness testimony, detailed crime reports, forensic evidence and expert commentary by criminologists, detectives, pathologists and journalists.(n)

programme.title: Great Artists
programme.desc: Tim Marlow charts the life of Greek artist Domenicos Theotocopolous, dubbed El Greco, one of the most distinctive painters of the 16th century. His work was considered to be ahead of its time - so much so that it was all but ignored for 300 years. El Greco developed a highly individualistic style that eventually proved enormously influential, paving the way for the Baroque and providing the inspiration for 20th-century expressionism.(n)

programme.title: The Dog Rescuers with Alan Davies
programme.desc: Alan catches up with a spaniel that was rescued by the RSPCA, and is now beginning training to become a police sniffer dog. An inspector tries to help a Jack Russell with a skin condition, but the owner is not willing to let her interfere, and a dog is found tied to a radiator with neither food nor water.(n)

programme.title: The Hotel Inspector
programme.desc: Alex Polizzi pays a visit to Devon's historic Churston Court. Chris Hodson and Jonathan Smith fell in love with the old building with their hearts rather their heads, and five months in the pair now realise the amount of work needed to bring the hotel into the 21st century. Alex arrives a night early to find a cluttered, dark decor with no one on reception and quickly realises she needs to help motivate Chris to change the way he manages his team. Can she reverse decades of ugly decor, teach her hosts to clear the clutter, erase the oppressive red and herald a more glamorous, curated look?.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother
programme.desc: Daily round-up of highlights, revealing how the housemates are getting on under the all-seeing eye of Big Brother, featuring the latest tasks, games, arguments, laughs, diary room visits and bedroom chit-chat. Narrated by Marcus Bentley.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother's Bit on the Side
programme.desc: Rylan Clark-Neal has the latest developments and invites his studio audience and celebrity guests to discuss how the Big Brother housemates are getting on.(n)

programme.title: Body of Lies
programme.desc: When idealistic CIA agent Roger Ferris is stationed in Jordan after being wounded in Iraq, he dedicates his life to stopping further attacks by Al Qaeda. Following a plan that the British employed successfully against the Nazis, Ferris plants the suspicion among the terrorists that their leaders are collaborating with the Americans. But as the stakes rise and Ferris finds himself in the crosshairs, the plot he starts spirals into an outcome he could never have foreseen(n)

programme.title: Live Free or Die Hard
programme.desc: Bruce Willis returns once again as John McClane, the wisecracking, old-school New York cop whose impressive CV includes rescuing hostages captured in a swanky LA plaza and saving passengers on a hijacked plane circling Washington. In this violent thriller, he's up against a group of terrorists threatening to hack into the US computer infrastructure. When they crash the stock market, sending the economy into meltdown and causing panic on Wall Street, McClane turns to young hacker Matt Farrell. Farrell's wanted by the FBI, but he's also potentially the only man who can help figure out the cyber criminals' next move. When the terrorists respond by kidnapping McClane's daughter Lucy, it's time for the anxious father to load up his ammo clips and go get the bad guys - just as the country's descending into chaos(n)

programme.title: Scent of a Woman
programme.desc: Driven by an extravagant, tour-de-force performance by Al Pacino, Scent of a Woman is the story of Frank Slade (Pacino), a blind, retired army colonel who hires Charlie Simms (Chris O'Donnell), a poor college student on the verge of expulsion, to take care of him over Thanksgiving weekend. At the beginning of the weekend, Frank takes Charlie to New York, where he reveals to the student that he intends to visit his family, have a few terrific meals, sleep with a beautiful woman and, finally, commit suicide. The film follows the mis-matched pair over the course of the weekend, as they learn about life through their series of adventures. Though the story is a little contrived and predictable, it pulls all the right strings, thanks to O'Donnell's sympathetic supporting role and Pacino's powerful lead performance, for which he won his first Academy Award. Scent of a Woman is based on the 1975 Italian film Profumo Di Donna(n)

programme.title: Dog Day Afternoon
programme.desc: Sonny plans a bank robbery to pay for a sex-change operation for his gay lover. But when the heist goes wrong, he and silent Sal take the bank staff hostage(n)

programme.title: Aliens
programme.desc: James Cameron took the helm for this equally frightening sequel, with Sigourney Weaver reprising her role as Ellen Ripley. Back on Earth, she is now safe but depressed until she's chosen to head a task force back to the planet where they first encountered the alien, now colonised by humans - with whom contact has been lost. This time, it's a whole hive of aliens who pick off the force one by one until it's just Ripley and young Newt, the sole surviving colonist, against the alien queen(n)

programme.title: In the Heart of the Sea
programme.desc: In this harrowing historical drama set in the winter of 1820, the crew of the New England whaling ship the Essex struggle to survive after an attack by a rogue sperm whale leaves them stranded at sea for 90 days(n)

programme.title: Gods of Egypt
programme.desc: A young thief named Bek enlists the help of the powerful Egyptian god Horus to overthrow the vicious deity Set, who has seized control of the land. Bek's true love has been captured, forcing the mortal rebel to fight back in order to free her and the people of Egypt from Set's tyrannical rule(n)

programme.title: Any Given Sunday
programme.desc: Oliver Stone takes on professional football, a sport whose grace and delicacy are a good match for his filmmaking style. Tony D'Amato (Al Pacino), the head coach of the Miami Sharks, won back-to-back championships four years ago. But new team owner Christina Pagniacci (Cameron Diaz) has little enthusiasm for the finer points of the game and is concerned only with the bottom line. The longtime strongman of Tony's team has been "Cap" Rooney (Dennis Quaid), a 39-year-old quarterback, but Christina balks at renewing his contract. When Cap is injured during a game, third-string rookie quarterback Willie Beaman (Jamie Foxx) goes on in his place and becomes a major star. But Beaman is mostly interested in fame and money, and he has little regard for Tony and his teammates. Any Given Sunday also stars James Woods as the team's doctor, LL Cool J as a star running back, Jim Brown as a former football great turned Sharks' defensive coordinator, Ann-Margret as Christina's alcoholic mother, Bill Bellamy as a wide receiver, Elizabeth Berkley as Tony's favorite prostitute, and Charlton Heston as the football commissioner(n)

programme.title: Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: Kevin Costner stars in this epic western biopic chronicling the life of legendary lawman Wyatt Earp, from Dodge City to the shootout at the OK Corral(n)

programme.title: Pale Rider
programme.desc: Clint Eastwood stars as the mysterious preacher determined to stop ruthless landowners from stealing the land of a group of poor gold miners(n)

programme.title: The Take
programme.desc: An artist and an ex-CIA agent work together to take down terrorists in France(n)

programme.title: Pride and Glory
programme.desc: Gavin O'Connor's New York-set police corruption thriller starring Edward Norton, Colin Farrell and Jon Voight. When four cops are shot dead in a drugs bust gone bad, detective Ray Tierney is persuaded by his father, NYPD chief Francis Sr, to lead the investigation into what went wrong. But as Ray delves further, it becomes ever more apparent that the corruption he uncovers no only threatens scandal for the Washington Heights precinct, but is also likely to rip apart his own family, most of whom are also in the force(n)

programme.title: The Mark of Zorro
programme.desc: The son of an aristocrat in 19th-century California dons a mask to help fight for the downtrodden people oppressed by a wicked governor. Complicating matters is the vigilante's affections for the governor's beautiful niece(n)

programme.title: In America
programme.desc: Jim Sheridan ("My Left Foot") co-wrote and directed this heartwarming drama about a scrappy Irish clan adjusting to life in a New York City tenement in the 1980s while trying to put a family tragedy behind them. Samantha Morton, Paddy Considine, Djimon Hounsou, Sarah Bolger, Emma Bolger, Juan Hernandez, Jason Salkey, Rene Millan(n)

programme.title: Domestic Disturbance
programme.desc: John Travolta stars in Harold Becker's film as the ex-husband of Teri Polo, now married to Vince Vaughn. But when her son sees the seemingly placid Vaughn kill an ex-colleague, he has to persuade his dad that he and Polo are next in line(n)

programme.title: The Day the Earth Stood Still
programme.desc: A remake of the 1951 classic sci-fi film about an alien's foreboding visit to earth(n)

programme.title: The Sum of All Fears
programme.desc: CIA agent Jack Ryan races to avert war between Russia and the US after a terrorist threatens to detonate a nuclear bomb(n)

programme.title: Die Hard
programme.desc: It's Christmas time in L.A., and there's an employee party in progress on the 30th floor of the Nakatomi Corporation building. The revelry comes to a violent end when the partygoers are taken hostage by a group of terrorists headed by Hans Gruber (Alan Rickman), who plan to steal the 600 million dollars locked in Nakatomi's high-tech safe. In truth, Gruber and his henchmen are only pretending to be politically motivated to throw the authorities off track; also in truth, Gruber has no intention of allowing anyone to get out of the building alive. Meanwhile, New York cop John McClane (Bruce Willis) has come to L.A. to visit his estranged wife, Holly (Bonnie Bedelia), who happens to be one of the hostages. Disregarding the orders of the authorities surrounding the building, McClane, who fears nothing (except heights), takes on the villains, armed with one handgun and plenty of chutzpah. Until Die Hard came along, Bruce Willis was merely that wisecracking guy on Moonlighting. After the film's profits started rolling in, Willis found himself one of the highest-paid and most sought-after leading men in Hollywood(n)

programme.title: The Informant!
programme.desc: When Mark Whitacre discovers that his company is involved in price-fixing, he becomes an informant for the FBI. Convinced he'll be hailed as a hero for his efforts, he agrees to wear a wire and gathers evidence to convict his bosses. Unfortunately, both the case and Whitacre's integrity are compromised when the FBI agents discover that he isn't the saintly figure he made himself out to be(n)

programme.title: Keeping the Faith
programme.desc: Best friends, a priest (Norton) and a rabbi (Stiller) both fall in love with the same girl (Elfman). However, neither of the men can pursue the relationship due to their religious beliefs: the priest cannot break his vow of celibacy and the rabbi cannot marry her since she is not Jewish(n)

programme.title: Forgetting Sarah Marshall
programme.desc: In this fizzy, funny take on the classic screwball comedy, Jason Segel ("How I Met Your Mother") stars as a lovelorn composer who flies to a Hawaiian resort in hopes of forgetting the woman who broke his heart (Kristen Bell, "Veronica Mars"). But when he arrives he realizes she and her new boyfriend have just checked in. Mila Kunis, Russell Brand, Bill Hader(n)

programme.title: The Adventures of Ford Fairlane
programme.desc: Stand-up comic Andrew Dice Clay stars as Los Angeles private-eye Ford Fairlane in this outrageous comedy-adventure. A detective to the stars, Fairlane is called in to investigate the mysterious death of a heavy metal singer, soon finding himself embroiled in a dangerous plot of treachery, double-cross and murder(n)

programme.title: Carlito's Way
programme.desc: Determined to go straight, he only agrees to take part in a shady business deal at his attorney's instigation in order to discharge the debt of gratitude he owes. Despite his intentions and love for his girlfriend, Carlito finds himself relentlessly drawn back into the world he sought to escape(n)

programme.title: The Vanishing
programme.desc: When Jeff's girlfriend is abducted by a highly intelligent psychopath, his only hope of finding her is to put himself in the kidnapper's hands(n)

programme.title: Body of Lies
programme.desc: When idealistic CIA agent Roger Ferris is stationed in Jordan after being wounded in Iraq, he dedicates his life to stopping further attacks by Al Qaeda. Following a plan that the British employed successfully against the Nazis, Ferris plants the suspicion among the terrorists that their leaders are collaborating with the Americans. But as the stakes rise and Ferris finds himself in the crosshairs, the plot he starts spirals into an outcome he could never have foreseen(n)

programme.title: Live Free or Die Hard
programme.desc: Bruce Willis returns once again as John McClane, the wisecracking, old-school New York cop whose impressive CV includes rescuing hostages captured in a swanky LA plaza and saving passengers on a hijacked plane circling Washington. In this violent thriller, he's up against a group of terrorists threatening to hack into the US computer infrastructure. When they crash the stock market, sending the economy into meltdown and causing panic on Wall Street, McClane turns to young hacker Matt Farrell. Farrell's wanted by the FBI, but he's also potentially the only man who can help figure out the cyber criminals' next move. When the terrorists respond by kidnapping McClane's daughter Lucy, it's time for the anxious father to load up his ammo clips and go get the bad guys - just as the country's descending into chaos(n)

programme.title: Scent of a Woman
programme.desc: Driven by an extravagant, tour-de-force performance by Al Pacino, Scent of a Woman is the story of Frank Slade (Pacino), a blind, retired army colonel who hires Charlie Simms (Chris O'Donnell), a poor college student on the verge of expulsion, to take care of him over Thanksgiving weekend. At the beginning of the weekend, Frank takes Charlie to New York, where he reveals to the student that he intends to visit his family, have a few terrific meals, sleep with a beautiful woman and, finally, commit suicide. The film follows the mis-matched pair over the course of the weekend, as they learn about life through their series of adventures. Though the story is a little contrived and predictable, it pulls all the right strings, thanks to O'Donnell's sympathetic supporting role and Pacino's powerful lead performance, for which he won his first Academy Award. Scent of a Woman is based on the 1975 Italian film Profumo Di Donna(n)

programme.title: Dog Day Afternoon
programme.desc: Sonny plans a bank robbery to pay for a sex-change operation for his gay lover. But when the heist goes wrong, he and silent Sal take the bank staff hostage(n)

programme.title: Scrubs
programme.desc: My Tuscaloosa Heart. JD is assigned one of his most difficult patients yet: Mr Simon, a grumpy man suffering from colon cancer. In a bid to avoid his belittling, JD manages to reduce contact with him to the bare essentials. But when Mr Smith dies, JD learns a lesson in patient care when he is ordered to go before the morbidity and mortality board. Meanwhile, Dr Cox discovers that three women are too much to handle, and Elliot uncovers Dr. Kelso's musical past(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show

She needs to find a replacement, or else lose her job; so she and Fez take the place of the missing guest, pretending to be a couple in love. Christine is so impressed that she takes Jackie out for drinks after work, and spills some personal secrets, then fires Jackie for knowing too much. programme.channel: Crime and Investigation Network HDTV (CI HD)
programme.title: Evil Up Close
programme.desc: The Costa Killer: David Baxendale. La Costa del Sol se convirtió en un refugio para muchos criminales británicos en los años '90 gracias a un acuerdo de extradición muy ambígua e informal entre España y Reino Unido. Así estos fugitivos pudieran esconderse de la justicia entre los vacacionistas que acuden cada año a la región. Uno de ellos, David Baxendale, era violento y adicto al alcohol y las drogas. Ya había apuñalado a dos personas en Inglaterra y cumplió condena en prisión por ambos delitos. En la Costa del Sol, Baxendale, después de haber bebido demasiado, apuñaló a un hombre 14 veces. A pesar de una condena por asesinato, sus crímenes continuaban. Finalmente mientras cumplía libertad condicional en Inglaterra, acompañó a una mujer a su departamento, entro en un ataque de cólera y de una puñalada al cuello, le cortó la arteria carótida(n)

programme.desc: Jeff tries his best to make Brenda laugh when he discovers she is suffering incontinence in her pregnancy, but his antics cause her waters to break. Meanwhile, Adam annoys Audrey by talking excessively during a spa trip, Timmy struggles to get to grips with the professional manner of his new boss and Russell is frustrated by his new assistant.(n)

programme.title: Rules of Engagement
programme.desc: Brenda goes into labour on Jen and Adam's wedding day, leaving the groom to persuade his wife-to-be to make alternative arrangements for their big day. Meanwhile, Russell's carelessness causes Timmy's work visa to expire.(n)

programme.title: Melissa & Joey
programme.desc: When Joe and Ryder sell some of Mel's old belongings, they accidentally dispose of a very personal item that she wants to get back. Desperate to reclaim it, Mel and Joe turn to crime to achieve their aims. Elsewhere, Lennox discovers that her new pen pal wants to meet her in person. Comedy, starring Melissa Joan Hart and Joey Lawrence.(n)

programme.title: Melissa & Joey
programme.desc: Joe begins dating Candice (Krista Allen), the mother of one of the students he is tutoring, and devises an alternative payment plan for her. However, he winds up earning himself a bad reputation among the other mothers in the neighbourhood. Family comedy, starring Melissa Joan Hart and Joey Lawrence.(n)

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: Ben tries to get Emma into daycare by flirting with the assistant manager, Megan, who insists there is no space, until she thinks that Ben and Tucker are a gay couple. Meanwhile, Riley worries that Dr Amy Shaw is trying to change Danny when he turns his back on their traditional `Halfaween' costume party. Comedy, starring Jean-Luc Bilodeau, and guest starring Grace Phipps and Lacey Chabert.(n)

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: Ben, Danny and Tucker go in search of Emma's missing stuffed animal toy. Meanwhile Riley hosts a book club in a bid to make friends with the cool girls at work - but faces trouble when her mother and Bonnie invite themselves along. Comedy, starring Jean-Luc Bilodeau, with guest star Caroline Rhea.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Ted visits a matchmaker with a 100 per cent success record, but the only woman she can find who is compatible with him is already in a relationship. Lily and Marshall's apartment is invaded by a strange creature. Sitcom, starring Josh Radnor and Alyson Hannigan.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Lily's flat is turned into a Chinese restaurant, forcing her to move in with Marshall. However, Barney convinces Ted he will be driven from the house now his flatmate's fiancee is in residence. Comedy, starring Josh Radnor, Neil Patrick Harris, Alyson Hannigan, Jason Segel and Cobie Smulders.(n)

programme.title: New Girl
programme.desc: Jess drowns her sorrows after splitting up with Russell, and finds herself spending the night with ex-boyfriend Paul (guest star Justin Long). Nick is also in danger of falling back into a former relationship, while Cece takes Schmidt to visit her grandmother (Madhur Jaffrey) in a nursing home.(n)

programme.title: New Girl
programme.desc: Nick packs up his possessions in preparation for moving in with Caroline. However, he has a panic attack while taking the removal van to his new flat and carries on driving until he reaches the desert, forcing Jess and Cece to come to the rescue. Winston joins them on the trip, and faces his fear of the dark.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard's purchase of a dining-room table causes Sheldon to re-evaluate his life. Meanwhile, Howard is offered the chance to go back to the International Space Station, and Bernadette struggles to decide whether to encourage him. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Melissa Rauch.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: After arguing with Sheldon, Howard tries to make amends by taking him to Nasa's headquarters in Houston. Elsewhere, Penny has second thoughts about quitting her job as a waitress when her car dies, while Amy tries to find Raj a date. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: Melissa & Joey
programme.desc: Mel wants to get a dog for the household, but Joe is against the idea and argues that he will be the one who gets stuck looking after the animal all off the time. Meanwhile, Ryder finds himself spending more and more time with Stella's daughter rather than with Stella herself. Starring Melissa Joan Hart and Joey Lawrence.(n)

programme.title: Melissa & Joey
programme.desc: Zander comes to the house to see Lennox and she begins to feel conflicted about dating her teaching assistant. Meanwhile, Mel persuades Joe to attend a couples therapy session - but is caught off guard when the therapist turns out to be one of his ex-girlfriends. Family comedy, starring Melissa Joan Hart and Joey Lawrence.(n)

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: Bonnie thinks that Danny and Ben buying the bar is a bad idea and uses underhand tactics to sabotage their plans. Riley takes Tucker's damage lawsuit to court but finds out too late that the case is based on falsehoods. Comedy, starring Melissa Peterman and Jean-Luc Bilodeau.(n)

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: In a bid to sabotage Riley and Ross' blossoming relationship, Ben urges her kindhearted boyfriend to take part in a strenuous athletic competition. Bonnie is also in competitive mood because she wants to play poker with the boys - despite Tucker's strong opposition. Comedy, starring Jean-Luc Bilodeau.(n)

programme.title: Black-ish
programme.desc: Dre tries to expand Andre Jr's social circle, and Rainbow drags Diane along to work, in the hope that a day at the hospital will inspire her to become a doctor.(n)

programme.title: Black-ish
programme.desc: Dre takes over Rainbow's chores for a week, but the lavish praise he receives from the people at his children's school rapidly goes to his head.(n)

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Barry needs the money to buy an expensive new pair of basketball trainers, so Murray hires him to work at his furniture shop. Beverly refuses to let Adam see a new horror film, but he goes behind her back and tricks Pops into taking him to the cinema. Comedy, starring Wendi McLendon-Covey and Jeff Garlin.(n)

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Beverly tries to find Pops a person to settle down with, and sets him up on a date with a woman called Sophia who seems to fit his demanding criteria. Meanwhile, Adam and Barry bond over their discovery of a new TV channel. Comedy, starring Wendi McLendon-Covey and Jeff Garlin.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Penny attempt to prove Sheldon wrong when he claims that he and Amy have a superior relationship. programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Raj's girlfriend Emily (Laura Spencer) gives Penny the cold shoulder when she learns about his past. Meanwhile, the guys debate investing in Stuart's comic-book shop and becoming part owners of the business. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Milo uncovers a tattoo on his back with a cryptic message that suggests a dark secret.(n)

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Murray is honoured as one of the area's top businessmen, Beverly's attempt to help her husband find a hobby backfires, and Erica comes to Barry's rescue.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Sheldon discover their favourite childhood TV science show host Professor Proton can be booked for private parties and decide to hire him to entertain them. programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard is offered an exciting job opportunity, but it will mean he has to leave the country for several months. Penny tries to support his ambitions, while Sheldon is jealous and attempts to discourage him from accepting the post. Meanwhile, Raj pushes the boundaries with Lucy, but puts their relationship in jeopardy.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The friends fight over a ring they believe was used in the Lord of the Rings film trilogy. Leonard hopes to return the item to its rightful owner - but Raj wishes to sell it so he can buy a jet ski, and Sheldon develops a Gollum-like obsession with the precious object.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: When the guys are unable to get tickets for the Comic-Con, Leonard, Howard and Raj decide to buy fake passes from a stranger - but they then worry about getting caught with them. Sheldon decides to hold his own comic-book convention and searches for a suitable star guest for the event. Meanwhile, the girls take tea at a hotel but discover that maturity is over-rated. programme.title: Extreme Fishing with Robson Green
programme.desc: The actor visits South Australia, where he dives for abalone, a type of large sea snail, in the waters just south of Port Lincoln. He next heads west to Perth to catch blue manna crab for a traditional Australia Day barbecue, before handling venomous octopuses on a boat in Fremantle. Robson then returns to Port Lincoln to take part in the World Championship Tuna Toss.(n)

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: With the arrival of autumn the Arctic Ocean begins freezing over, and polar bears gather in large numbers on the coast as they await the return of the ice. Two thousand beluga whales head for a particular estuary to thrash against the gravel and exfoliate, while in Antarctica, Adelie penguins take to the sea for the first time and face the danger of leopard seal attacks.(n)

programme.title: Wild France
programme.desc: Part two of two. The unique ecosystem of the Marais Poitevin, where seawater and freshwater come together. Dragonfly larvae gestate in the region's waters, and swim to the surface and fly away once their development is over.(n)

programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: Colin Salmon narrates a documentary exploring how the lives of humans and animals across a vast area of the planet are affected by the transforming power of the monsoon rains. The end of the dry season in northern Australia sees 300,000 flying foxes gathering to drink while running a gauntlet of freshwater crocodiles, while in Sumatra a female orang-utan guides her youngster to where she knows a fig tree fruits at this time of year. At the Delhi stock exchange, the price of rice escalates every day the rains fail to materialise and priests submerge themselves in water and beseech Varuna, god of water, to come.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Fishing with Robson Green
programme.desc: The actor visits South Australia, where he dives for abalone, a type of large sea snail, in the waters just south of Port Lincoln. He next heads west to Perth to catch blue manna crab for a traditional Australia Day barbecue, before handling venomous octopuses on a boat in Fremantle. Robson then returns to Port Lincoln to take part in the World Championship Tuna Toss.(n)

programme.title: Secret Life Underground
programme.desc: Part two of two. Documentary making use of cutting-edge technology to explore the rich biodiversity of soil, revealing why what lies beneath the surface is not just a simple eco-system, but actually a living organism in which countless creatures exist in a state of inter-dependence.(n)
