programme.title: Wild Ones
programme.desc: A look at some of the world's strongest creatures.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: The Mekong River with Sue Perkins
programme.desc: The comedienne and Great British Bake Off presenter embarks on a 3,000-mile journey along the Southeast Asian river, exploring lives and landscapes on the point of dramatic change. She begins in Vietnam, where she meets traditional river people caught up in a new capitalist revolution, before trying her hand as a noodle saleswoman and prawn farmer. Continuing to Cambodia, she is moved by the tale of a survivor of Pol Pot's genocide, before bonding with the residents of a floating village whose survival depends on the bounty of Tonle Sap, the largest freshwater lake in Asia.(n)

programme.title: Secrets of Bones
programme.desc: Evolutionary biologist Ben Garrod explores how having a skeleton has helped vertebrates to colonise and dominate almost every habitat on Earth. He begins his journey by looking at the influence of bones on size, revealing how they are capable of supporting large animals, with the strongest bone able to withstand 109 tons of pressure.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Fishing with Robson Green
programme.desc: During a visit to Thailand, the actor samples the delights of Bangkok's famed fish market before trying to land arapaima. He visits the River Kwai to learn traditional fishing techniques, spends a night on a raft in the middle of a lake, and rounds off his trip with a hunt for stingray.(n)

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines how the arrival of winter sparks a ruthless battle for survival in the polar regions, with temperatures plummeting to -70C, winds reaching 120mph and day-long darkness. As a blizzard rages, a polar bear treks into the Arctic mountains to give birth, while the entire world population of spectacled eider braves the weather in a giant ice hole. Wolves and bison engage in battle, but alliances are also made, and beneath the snow, voles try to dodge the attacks of great grey owls and weasels.(n)

programme.title: The Mekong River with Sue Perkins
programme.desc: The comedienne and Great British Bake Off presenter embarks on a 3,000-mile journey along the Southeast Asian river, exploring lives and landscapes on the point of dramatic change. Continuing to Cambodia, she is moved by the tale of a survivor of Pol Pot's genocide, before bonding with the residents of a floating village whose survival depends on the bounty of Tonle Sap, the largest freshwater lake in Asia.(n)

programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: The effect of the rainy season on wildlife in Asia, with floods forcing animals to flee from Kaziranga National Park in north-east India in search of the safety of the hills. In Cambodia, the Mekong river swells so much that water is forced back up one of its tributaries to fill the vast Tonle Sap lake - one of the most productive freshwater fisheries on Earth. Fresh grass draws nomads and their vast herds of livestock back to their homelands, but they are stalked by hungry wolves and hyenas, which move in at night for the kill. Colin Salmon narrates.(n)

programme.title: Tarsier Tails
programme.desc: Sleep does not coming easily to young White Rock Tower tarsier Santoso.(n)

programme.title: Tarsier Tails
programme.desc: The documentary following the lives of tarsiers on the Indonesian island of Sulawesi concludes, as the Burnt Rock Tower clan endures humid conditions. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Cable Guy
programme.desc: Life goes haywire for yuppie Matthew Broderick when manic TV man Jim Carrey knocks on the door. He wanted an installer, not a stalker!(n)

programme.title: The Ringer
programme.desc: A young guy's only option to erase a really bad debt is to rig the Special Olympics by posing as a contestant, hoping to dethrone the reigning champion(n)

programme.title: Idiocracy
programme.desc: Private Joe Bauers, the definition of "average American", is selected by the Pentagon to be the guinea pig for a top-secret hibernation program. Forgotten, he awakes 500 years in the future. He discovers a society so incredibly dumbed-down that he's easily the most intelligent person alive(n)

programme.title: Dragonheart
programme.desc: The last dragon and a disillusioned dragon-slaying knight must cooperate to stop an evil king who was given partial immortality(n)

programme.title: Days of Thunder
programme.desc: Top Gun with cars. Breakneck action starring racing driver Tom Cruise in his first pairing with Nicole Kidman. Robert Duvall's the veteran who's been there before(n)

programme.title: Paul Blart: Mall Cop
programme.desc: Kevin James cowrote and stars in this farce about a mild-mannered security guard at a New Jersey mall who has to save the day when a gang of thieves try to pull a big heist(n)

programme.title: You Don't Mess With the Zohan
programme.desc: Zohan is a disco-loving Israeli commando with unstoppable fighting skills and a secret dream: he yearns to move to New York City and become a hairdresser. After faking his own death, he makes that dream come true(n)

programme.title: Friday After Next
programme.desc: The gang from Friday and Next Friday are back in this urban comedy, in which Craig (Ice Cube) and Day-Day (Mike Epps) have finally moved out of their respective parents' homes and gotten an apartment together. However, a bogus neighborhood Santa Claus (Rickey Smiley) decides to help Craig and Day-Day share the wealth by robbing their apartment, and when he rips off their stereo, he also makes off with their rent money, which was hidden in the speaker cabinets. Desperate to make rent and have some money for Christmas presents, Craig and Day-Day land jobs at a local strip mall, where their fathers, Mr. Jones (John Witherspoon) and Uncle Elroy (Don "D.C." Curry), have gone into business together running a barbecue joint. Craig and Day-Day are installed as security guards, and while Craig tries to make time with Donna (K.D. Aubert), a saleswoman at the Pimp N' Ho's Boutique, and keep things orderly at Holy Moly's Doughnut Shop, Day-Day attempts to transform himself into a master of crime-fighting, which causes a lot more problems than it solves. Friday After Next is the first feature film from director Marcus Raboy, who previously directed music videos for Sting, Li'l Kim, Staind, and Friday After Next star Ice Cube(n)

programme.title: The Fifth Element
programme.desc: A 23rd-century New York City cabbie encounters a genetically engineered alien named Leeloo, who has the life force that can unite the planet's elements and stave off a raging fireball that's on a collision course with Earth(n)

programme.title: Paul Blart: Mall Cop
programme.desc: Kevin James cowrote and stars in this farce about a mild-mannered security guard at a New Jersey mall who has to save the day when a gang of thieves try to pull a big heist(n)

programme.title: Black Sheep
programme.desc: Political comedy in which a prospective state governor's election prospects are jeopardised by his wayward younger brother. Expecting his mischievous sibling to be something of a liability during his campaign, the aspiring politician orders one of his aides to keep him out of the public eye - a task he does not relish(n)

programme.title: The River Wild
programme.desc: Fast-paced action and adventure as Gail, a whitewater rafting guide, and her family pick up two strangers on a rafting trip(n)

programme.title: The People vs. Larry Flynt
programme.desc: Woody Harrelson earned a Best Actor nomination as brassy Hustler publisher Larry Flynt in this bold biography. The film follows Flynt from his childhood as a moonshine runner to his highly publicized court battles on obscenity and libel charges, which developed into an ongoing war to defend his freedom of speech. Courtney Love costars as Flynt's stripper wife. Edward Norton, James Cromwell, Crispin Glover, James Carville, Brett Harrelson(n)

programme.title: Jerry Maguire
programme.desc: Tom Cruise is at his best in this comedy-drama about a sports agent who falls from the top of his profession. Jerry Maguire is a key agent at Sports Management International, with a string of high-profile clients, a stunning girlfriend called Avery (Kelly Preston) and all the friends he could want. But Jerry wants something else - a more caring spirit within his company. After setting out his ideas in a mission statement, Jerry finds himself unceremoniously fired, and everything he has worked so hard to achieve suddenly disappears. Fortunately, he is able to take with him one member of staff - single mother Dorothy Boyd (Renee Zellweger) - and one reluctant client, Rod Tidwell (Cuba Gooding, Jr). Armed with nothing but his charm, his good looks and the ability to sell just about anything to just about anyone, Jerry begins the long fight back to the top(n)

programme.title: Side Effects
programme.desc: A woman commits a horrific act while taking an anti-anxiety drug, which leads to a criminal investigation of her therapist that digs up possible evidence of past indiscretions(n)

programme.title: Jarhead
programme.desc: US Marine Anthony Swofford may be a top sniper, but will he ever get to take the shot he's been trained for? Boredom and bullets in Sam Mendes' gritty Gulf War drama(n)

programme.title: Black Sheep
programme.desc: Political comedy in which a prospective state governor's election prospects are jeopardised by his wayward younger brother. Expecting his mischievous sibling to be something of a liability during his campaign, the aspiring politician orders one of his aides to keep him out of the public eye - a task he does not relish(n)

programme.title: Dodgeball: A True Underdog Story
programme.desc: Bound to stir up good and bad memories of an adolescent rite of passage, director Rawson Marshall Thurber's outrageous nerds-vs.-jocks comedy pits a misfit dodgeball team against a squad sponsored by a corporate giant. Ben Stiller, Vince Vaughn, Christine Taylor, Rip Torn, Stephen Root, Gary Cole, Jason Bateman, Justin Long, Joel David Moore, Alan Tudyk, Chris Williams(n)

programme.title: Walk the Line
programme.desc: Oscar-nominee Joaquin Phoenix plays Johnny Cash, and Oscar-winner Reese Witherspoon plays June Carter in James Mangold's acclaimed biographical film about country music's legendary 'Man in Black'. The film follows Cash from his childhood, where he was touched by tragedy, through his years on the road to his marriage to June Carter, who was country royalty (having been a part of the massively influential Carter Family band), and their struggle to find happiness as she weans him off booze and drugs. Walk the Line is a warts-and-all biopic, showing Cash's faults as well as his undoubted star quality as one of the greatest singer/songwriters that America has ever produced(n)

programme.title: Black Sheep
programme.desc: Political comedy in which a prospective state governor's election prospects are jeopardised by his wayward younger brother. Expecting his mischievous sibling to be something of a liability during his campaign, the aspiring politician orders one of his aides to keep him out of the public eye - a task he does not relish(n)

programme.title: Starship Troopers
programme.desc: Humans in a fascistic, militaristic future do battle with giant alien bugs in a fight for survival(n)

programme.title: Commando
programme.desc: Action-adventure starring Arnold Schwarzenegger as a former special agent who reluctantly returns to duty when his daughter is kidnapped by a gang of right-wing extremists(n)

programme.title: Varsity Blues
programme.desc: Dawson's Creek hunk James Van Der Beek breaks onto the big screen in this high school drama about American football. He's joined by Jon Voight as Coach Kilmer, a veteran who just wants his successful team to keep winning prizes. That's placed in jeopardy when the team's star captain is injured and the little-known quarterback John Moxon , a player with his own approach to the game, steps into his shoes(n)

programme.title: Machine Gun Preacher
programme.desc: Gerard Butler stars in Marc Forster's violent, fact-based drama about a substance-addicted criminal who finds God and relocates to Sudan to offer his own idiosyncratic brand of Christian charity. The film initially portrays Sam Childers as being a far from nice man: a misogynistic biker whose life is steeped in crime, narcotics and violence, and who quickly returns to armed robbery almost as soon as he's released from jail. But while he was inside, his wife Lynn found Jesus, and, after Sam gets stabbed, she urges him to join her at church. Sam subsequently has his own Damascene moment and starts life afresh, founding his own (legitimate) construction company. Before long he has also built his own church. But it's only after a trip to Sudan, where he witnesses the devastation wrought by the marauding Lord's Resistance Army, that he truly becomes driven. Relocating to the African country, he sets up a faith-based centre to care for victims of the LRA's violence and rape. And also takes up arms to literally fight the good fight... Also starring Michael Shannon(n)

programme.title: Tank
programme.desc: James Garner as a no-nonsense Army vet who uses his own tank to combat small-town injustices(n)

programme.title: Windtalkers
programme.desc: Two U.S. Marines in WWII are assigned to protect Navajo Marines who use their native language as an unbreakable radio cypher(n)

programme.title: Fist of Fury
programme.desc: Ancient rivalries come to the fore as students from a Japanese school of martial arts wage war on a rival Chinese dojo. The conflict takes a more serious turn when one of the fighters is killed, prompting a martial arts expert to seek vengeance on the murderers in a final do-or-die battle(n)

programme.title: The A-Team
programme.desc: The Big Squeeze. The Team opens its own restaurant, financed by the loan shark who scared another restaurateur out of taking the Team's help against him. Jack Lane: Wings Hauser. Hannibal: George Peppard. Nathan Vincent: Joseph Sirola. Gino: Al Ruscio(n)

programme.title: Tank
programme.desc: James Garner as a no-nonsense Army vet who uses his own tank to combat small-town injustices(n)

programme.desc: In his final film (one completed after his death with a number of cinematic tricks), Bruce Lee stars as a famous martial artist who has faced many enemies, but to give himself time to plan his revenge, he fakes his own death(n)

programme.title: Galaxy Quest
programme.desc: Comedy sci-fi adventure in which the stars of a 1970s sci-fi show, now scraping a living through re-runs and sci-fi conventions, are beamed aboard an alien spacecraft. Believing the cast's heroic on-screen dramas are historical documents of real-life adventures, the band of aliens turn to the ailing celebrities for help in their quest to overcome the oppressive regime in their solar system(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A popular teacher is found murdered and the team discovers hate mail in his bag. However, as the investigation gets under way, the agents discover the victim's behaviour had always been immaculate, ruling out any wrongdoing when traces of drugs are found in his car and a pupil accuses him of sleeping with a prostitute. Jane focuses on the relationship between the director of the school play and the lead actor, and even performs as an understudy to unravel more details about the crime. Starring Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Female impersonators come under suspicion when a man is found burnt to death on a cabaret bar's doorstep, but as Jane and the team investigate, they discover the victim was being bullied by more than one person, forcing them to try to lure the killer into the open. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.sub-title: So Long and Thanks for All the Red Snapper.
programme.desc: While investigating the murder of a surfer, Lisbon reconnects with her ex-fiance, whom she has not seen for more than a decade, and Cho questions whether he should be in a relationship with Summer. Crime drama, starring Robin Tunney, Tim Kang and Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane is consumed by memories of his wife and daughter as the eighth anniversary of their deaths arrives. To make matters worse, he is taunted by Red John, the serial killer he blames for their murders, and his lapse in concentration jeopardises Lisbon's latest case - as well as his position within the CBI. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda races to the scene of three murders, but when she arrives the bodies are nowhere to be found. To solve the case, the team must first locate the victims before the hunt for the killer can begin. Detective drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda investigates the death of a teenager who was due to appear in court to testify that a man convicted of murdering a Korean couple was not actually the culprit. However, several unexpected twists in the case make her wonder whether the boy was really going to tell the truth. Meanwhile, disaster strikes when Pope's ex-wife exposes one of his past relationships. Kyra Sedgwick stars.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: The wife of a crime boss is murdered in FBI custody. Brenda suspects the agent supposedly protecting her was corrupt and hastily tries to interrogate him before the FBI can regain control of the investigation. As the case unfolds, the team learns today's Mafia do not follow the traditional rules any more. Detective drama series, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Part one of two. Brenda takes involuntary leave, but ends up assisting an investigation into a murder linked to a terrorist group, while Commander Taylor takes advantage of her enforced layoff to try to break up the PHD. Crime drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs travels to his home town after hearing news of his father's death, while the team investigates whether a fire on a US Navy ship was accidental or planned. The vessel served as prison to several members of the Brotherhood of Doubt terrorist group, whom Gibbs was responsible for catching. After the blaze, two of those members are missing. Tony argues that Gibbs would want to know, but Vance does not want him disturbed at this difficult time. Mark Harmon stars.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Return of the American drama following the work of the Naval Criminal Investigative Service. Gibbs and McGee travel to Russia to escort a computer expert connected to classified intel. However, the mission is compromised and they are forced to go off the grid while being hunted by Russian mercenaries. Meanwhile, the team in DC frantically tries to locate the missing pair. Mark Harmon and Sean Murray star.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates the death of a Navy Lieutenant who has been murdered while on his way to a meeting with the President, and must ascertain whether the killing was part of a recent spate of muggings in the area - or a targeted hit to keep information secret. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Ducky works on a case involving his estranged childhood best friend, travelling to London with Special Agent Bishop to interview his pal's family and co-workers. programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Lois befriends local news presenter Joyce Kinney, who asks for permission to film a feature depicting her as the model American housewife. However, the report ends up making her look like a fool, so she sets out to put things right.(n)

programme.desc: Peter and Brian are forced to attend a 12-step AA meeting to kick their drinking habits following a public disturbance. programme.sub-title: Wheels and the Legman and the Case of Grandpa's Key.

programme.sub-title: A Very Special Family Guy Freakin' Christmas.

programme.desc: Brian is convicted of drink-driving and has to look after a cantankerous elderly woman as part of his community service. As their relationship develops, she reveals intriguing details of her past. Meanwhile, a swallow builds its nest in Peter's newly grown beard.(n)

programme.desc: Peter tries to rebuild a dispirited Joe's self-confidence by helping him train for the decathlon at the Paralympics - a daunting task made easier by the occasional discreet dose of steroids. Meanwhile, Stewie, Chris and Meg argue over $26 they find at a charity car wash.(n)

programme.title: Red Tails
programme.desc: The thrilling true story of the Tuskegee Airmen buzzes to the big screen in this epic war adventure from executive producer George Lucas and first-time feature director Anthony Hemingway. In the fire and chaos of World War II, the U.S. military recruits a fearless group of African-American fighter pilots to help reclaim the skies over Europe. Discriminated against both as citizens and as soldiers, the Tuskegee Airmen take flight in planes distinguished by distinctive red tails, and fight to defeat the tyranny of the Axis powers. As a result of their bravery, the pilots emerge as true heroes, and prove that all men are truly created equal. Terrence Howard, Cuba Gooding Jr., and Bryan Cranston star(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Where Were We?. In the first episode of season two, Ted's romantic luck has changed and he is bolstered by his new relationship with Robin, who still hasn't told him about her love of guns. Marshall is down in the dumps after his break-up with Lily and refuses to leave the flat for 40 days. Later, Marshall finds Lily's credit card bill and discovers that she's been staying in a hotel. When he goes to the room, he finds a man there(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: The Scorpion and the Toad. Lily comes back from San Francisco. She meets up with Robin and tells her about her great time in the city. Robin reports back to Ted who thinks Lily's hiding how miserable she is. Ted has a theory that Lily will blurt out the truth after three tequilas. After knocking back the shots and receiving bad news, Lily confesses that she wants Marshall back. Meanwhile, Marshall has a string of ill-fated nights out with Barney in a bid to meet new women. programme.desc: The thrilling true story of the Tuskegee Airmen buzzes to the big screen in this epic war adventure from executive producer George Lucas and first-time feature director Anthony Hemingway. In the fire and chaos of World War II, the U.S. military recruits a fearless group of African-American fighter pilots to help reclaim the skies over Europe. Discriminated against both as citizens and as soldiers, the Tuskegee Airmen take flight in planes distinguished by distinctive red tails, and fight to defeat the tyranny of the Axis powers. As a result of their bravery, the pilots emerge as true heroes, and prove that all men are truly created equal. Terrence Howard, Cuba Gooding Jr., and Bryan Cranston star(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Way We Was. After their TV goes on the blink, the Simpson family is faced with the grim prospect of having to actually talk to each other, and Marge (voice of Julie Kavner) decides to make the best of it by telling Lisa (voice of Yeardley Smith) and Bart (voice of Nancy Cartwright) the story of how she and Homer (voice of Dan Castellaneta) fell in love. It's 1974, and Homer Simpson is a skinny guy with a full head of hair who has no idea of what he wants to do with his future. Marge Bouvier has ended up in detention for the first time after burning a bra on school property in the midst of a brief infatuation with the women's movement. There she meets Homer, who has been kept after school yet again for smoking on school grounds. For Homer, it's love at first sight, and he's determined to find some way to get Marge's attention; pretending to be studying French, Homer gets Marge to tutor him, then asks her to the big dance. Marge says yes, but she's furious when she learns Homer isn't really taking French and that he kept her up late the night before a major forensics tournament. Marge decides instead to accept an invitation from debate club president Arnie Ziff (voice of Jon Lovitz) to go to the prom. Homer, however, never hears about this, figuring that if she never formally broke off their date, she'll still go with him, no matter how angry she is, and he finds himself going to the prom stag and watching Marge enjoy her big night with Artie. The Way We Was first aired on January 31, 1991(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer at the Bat. Homer signs up for the nuclear power plant's softball team(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Last Exit to Springfield. It's time for the workers at the Springfield Nuclear Power Plant to negotiate a new contract with management, but their union representative has gone missing, so a handful of employees take it upon themselves to present their demands to owner C. Montgomery Burns (voice of Harry Shearer). One of those employees is Homer Simpson (voice of Dan Castellaneta), who regrettably agrees to remove dental insurance from the employee benefit plan in the new contract in exchange for some free beer. Homer's decision comes back to haunt him when he finds out that his daughter Lisa (voice of Yeardley Smith) needs braces; Homer then persuades his fellow employees to vote down Burns' contract, and Homer is named the new union representative in the plant. Burns vows not to give in to the employee's demands, and finally Homer and his fellows go out on strike. In the meantime, Lisa still needs her braces, and the family is forced to settle on the cheapest they can find, which are even more conspicuous and unsightly than the average pair. "Last Exit to Springfield" was first aired on March 11, 1993(n)

programme.title: Halls of Montezuma

programme.title: Airplane II: The Sequel

Sadly, his prediction comes true when a computer malfunction sends the spacecraft hurtling toward the sun, while a man driven mad by sexual inadequacy smuggles a bomb on board. programme.title: The Drop
programme.desc: A Brooklyn bartender secretly provides a service delivering shipments of money to local gangsters. His criminal connections lead to his involvement in a robbery that goes disastrously wrong and digs up the long-buried secrets from his neighbourhood's past. programme.title: Northwest
programme.desc: A teenage burglar uses his ill-gotten gains to support his mother and younger brother. Longing for a more profitable line of work, he gets involved with a gangster, but soon he and his sibling are in over their heads as they are drawn into a world of drugs and prostitution. Crime drama, starring real-life brothers Gustav and Oscar Dyekjaer Giese. In Danish.(n)

programme.title: BSL Zone
programme.desc: Isaac has been going off the rails since his father left years ago but he returns with a startling secret.(n)

programme.title: Destry
programme.desc: A ruthless mobster and his cronies take over a small frontier town. When the local sheriff dies in mysterious circumstances, he appoints a drunk to office to consolidate his power. However, the inebriated official calls for the son of famous lawman to be his deputy and the new inclusion shows a fierce determination to see justice reign. Western, starring Audie Murphy, Mari Blanchard and Lyle Bettger.(n)

programme.title: Night Passage
programme.desc: The black sheep of a family falls in with a gang of outlaws plotting to rob a train operated by his strait-laced brother, but reckons without his sibling's determination to track him down and set him back on the straight and narrow. Western, starring James Stewart, Audie Murphy, Dan Duryea and Brandon de Wilde.(n)

programme.title: Master of the World
programme.desc: A Victorian hot air balloon expedition is captured by the captain of a hi-tech airship who intends to use his craft to bring about world peace by destroying military installations across the world. Sci-fi adventure based on Jules Verne's novels, starring Vincent Price and Charles Bronson, with Henry Hull and Mary Webster.(n)

programme.title: Mysterious Island
programme.desc: Soldiers escaping the American Civil War take flight in a giant observation balloon and land far away on a strange uncharted island, where they encounter giant creatures, cut-throat pirates, two shipwrecked Englishwomen - and the mysterious Captain Nemo. Sci-fi adventure based on Jules Verne's novel, starring Michael Craig, Herbert Lom, Joan Greenwood and Michael Callan, with special effects by Ray Harryhausen.(n)

programme.title: Johnny English
programme.desc: A bumbling secret agent becomes Britain's leading spy following the assassination of all the country's other espionage experts. Single-handedly he sets out to unmask a mysterious villain responsible for stealing the Crown Jewels - but no one is prepared to believe a sinister billionaire is the culprit. Comedy, starring Rowan Atkinson, John Malkovich, Natalie Imbruglia and Ben Miller.(n)

programme.title: War of the Planet of the Apes Interview Special
programme.desc: Director Matt Reeves and star Andy Serkis talk about making the third film in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Iceman
programme.desc: A Mob henchman becomes one of the criminal underworld's most notorious contract killers, responsible for the deaths of over 100 men. He conceals his activities behind the normal facade of an all-American family man for years, keeping his wife and daughters in the dark about his deadly profession. Fact-based crime drama, starring Michael Shannon, Winona Ryder and Chris Evans.(n)

programme.title: Stark Raving Mad
programme.desc: A nightclub owner has until dawn to pay his murdered brother's massive debts to ruthless gangsters. Desperate to get his hands on some ready cash, he formulates a plan to rob a bank and exact revenge on the murderous crooks. Unfortunately, events take an unexpected turn. Crime comedy, starring Seann William Scott, Timm Sharp and Lou Diamond Phillips.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa - Back to Basics
programme.desc: Na Garten prepares a series of recipes with fruit as the main ingredient.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa - Back to Basics
programme.desc: A mozzarella masterclass with a local cheese maker, and an Italian-inspired feast.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa - Back to Basics
programme.desc: Na Garten shares her vegetable based recipes for main courses, starters, salads and side-dishes.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa - Back to Basics
programme.desc: A behind-the-scenes look at what some chefs cook when they get home after work, with quick and easy recipes.(n)

programme.title: Anna Olson: Fresh
programme.desc: Chef Anna Olson auctions off her lunch-cooking services at a lakeside home.(n)

programme.title: Anna Olson: Fresh
programme.desc: Chef Anna Olson heads to a baby shower she is hosting, with appetisers and desserts including goat's cheese truffles, cornbread muffins with baby shrimp salad, and baby cherry pies.(n)

programme.title: The Healthy Gourmet
programme.desc: Can Ezra and Julie help Judi Parsons reduce her menu and get her back on the ice with her fishing friends.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond prepares a prairie picnic for friends, with chicken Milanese Mediterranean orzo salad, cold roasted veggies with herby yogurt dip, and pina colada tres leches cakes.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond prepares sides for the Thanksgiving feast, including broccoli wild rice casserole, sweet 'taters, and dressing with Brussels sprouts.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: The Drummonds celebrate the completion of their new office with a shrimp cocktail bar with three sauces, plus spicy Italian meatballs, bacon wrapped dates and sweet brownie pops.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond prepares brunch for three generations of Drummond girls, including maple oat nut scones, a cowgirl quiche, and champagne oranges.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Cake Wars
programme.desc: Four bakers go head-to-head to create chocolate centrepieces for a Valentine's Day wine tasting event, with world famous chocolatier Jonathan Grahm as the guest judge.(n)

programme.title: Real Girl's Kitchen
programme.desc: Haylie prepares barbecue pineapple pizza for the children to decorate with fresh veggies, as well as sliced apple cookies with salted dark chocolate almond butter.(n)

programme.title: Real Girl's Kitchen
programme.desc: Haylie prepares a Spanish-themed feast, including a dulce de leche cake and a birthday breakfast of farro cakes and strawberry crostinis, for her mother's birthday.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates the versatility of pastry as he prepares a variety of sweet and savoury recipes using pastry along with home-grown fruit and vegetables from his Essex garden. The chef shows how to create an Italian ham, nettle and spinach tart, a pie made with steak, Guinness and cheese, plus a traditional apple and blackberry pie.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver turns his attention to dishes using eggs collected from his hand-reared free-range hens. He creates a home-made tagliatelle, an omelette salad with bresaola, and a meringue with hot pears and chocolate sauce. He also starts some former battery hens off on their journey to a free-range life.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The first of the London and South East heats sees returning contender Adam Simmonds and newcomers Tom Sellers and Adam Byatt prepare their starters for the D-Day banquet. They must impress a mystery Great British Menu veteran if they are to cook in the regional final for judges Prue Leith, Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort and Joy Hunter, who worked in Winston Churchill's war cabinet as a secretary.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The London and South East chefs prepare seafood courses, with Adam Byatt hoping for inspiration from a visit to his grandmother's house to find out about his grandfather's military connections. There is also a surprise appearance in the kitchen by Tom Sellers' mentor and former Great British Menu champion Tom Aikens.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond makes roasted lemon chicken legs, Mexican macaroni salad, watermelon pico de gallo and brown sugar oatmeal cookies for a pet parade and potluck pinic.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond makes her favourite comfort food, including chicken and dumplings, quesadillas with shrimp and peppers, pasta with tomato cream sauce and cinnamon toast.(n)

programme.title: Chopped Junior
programme.desc: Spin-off from the cookery competition featuring young contestants.(n)

programme.title: Man Finds Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman searches for more secret eats in Mexico City, where he tries lamb barbacoa cooked underground at a restaurant hidden in an ancient cave.(n)

programme.title: Man Finds Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman explores Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, sampling a spicy burger and going on a nature hike that ends in the best grilled seafood in the city.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates the versatility of rhubarb, a plant that has been neglected in the UK even though the country produces some of the best crops in the world. The chef uses it as a foundation for a hot and sour dish with crispy pork and noodles, a ginger souffle and a creamy cocktail drink.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef reveals three simple ways to cook and dress asparagus, and demonstrates how best to use the vegetable in a meal. Gardener Brian also explains that once established, asparagus practically takes care of itself and can last for up to 20 years.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's American Road Trip
programme.desc: Crusading chef Jamie Oliver meets former gangsters, cowboys and high-society women as he embarks on a culinary journey to discover the heart and soul of America. He begins in Los Angeles, where he departs from the glitz and glamour of Hollywood to sample Mexican dishes away from the bright lights.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout
programme.sub-title: The Place is a Ghost Town.
programme.desc: Willie Degel visits Roasted Peppers in Mamaroneck, New York, where two chefs who became business partners are struggling to make ends meet.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: After already successfully battling one fast food chain over the rights to his signature sandwich, the owner of Devine Pastabilities now fears someone from within is trying to steal his creation.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: Fearing that his regular customers have become too entitled, Larry asks Charles Stiles to investigate. The Mystery Diners discover an employee may be creating the problem.(n)

programme.title: Bizarre Foods America

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: The owners of California's Sisley Italian Kitchen, Jamie and Francine, suspect that their bookkeeper may be responsible for a revenue discrepancy.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: The owner of Buster's Beach House in Long Beach calls Charles to investigate rumours that his executive chef is showing preferential treatment among the waiting staff.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa - Back to Basics
programme.desc: Ina Garten cooks with Grand Pellegrino for the famous Rao's restaurant, and finds out the best kitchens in America.(n)

programme.desc: Ina Garten showcases a range of cheeses and the best ways to prepare them.(n)

programme.desc: Ina and Jeffrey start the day with a fabulous breakfast, before heading off to Brooklyn for a culinary tour armed with a packed lunch, including a visit to a pizza place.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa

programme.title: Anna Olson: Fresh

programme.desc: Anna Olson celebrates the opening of her new food store, Hors D'Oeuvres, and makes a ham white pizza, truffled white bean salad, smoked trout mousse, and blueberry tiramisu tarts.(n)

programme.desc: Ezra and Julie are enlisted to help Luc Bradet overcome his phobia of vegetables.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Over an evening walk, Ree Drummond plans some fast and healthy meals, including a houmous wrap, ginger steak salad, a grilled nectarine salad and a spicy cauliflower stir-fry.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman

programme.desc: Ree Drummond stocks up on chicken breasts on a major bulk buy trip, for recipes such as Cobb salad, skillet chicken lasagna, Thai lettuce wraps, and chicken rice soup.(n)

programme.title: The Piglet Files
programme.desc: MI5 are invited to the Vishwani government's embassy - but terrorists besiege the building, leaving the agents attempting to save the day.(n)

programme.title: The Piglet Files
programme.sub-title: The Hunt for the Red Decoder.
programme.desc: A full-scale search is organised for a missing piece of Russian decoding equipment - which has mysteriously turned up at Peter's house.(n)

programme.title: Ever Decreasing Circles
programme.desc: Martin plans an afternoon of activities for an elderly friend and her cronies, but he reckons without Paul's interference. Richard Briers, Penelope Wilton and Peter Egan star.(n)

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: Gordon's life appears to be in danger, with a potential assassin apparently stalking the leisure centre. However, he is far more concerned with addressing the facility's falling attendance figures. Chris Barrie stars.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Plenty of Room in the Back.
programme.desc: After concluding she needs a new means of transport, Auntie Wainwright sends Tom and Smiler on a mission to collect her new vehicle - but it doesn't quite live up to their expectations. Jean Alexander, Tom Owen and Stephen Lewis star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Second Stag Night of Doggy Wilkinson.
programme.desc: Eric Sykes guest stars as absent-minded Doggy, who is disappointed when his stag night fails to live up to his expectations. However, Clegg, Truly, Alvin and Entwistle come up with a solution and soon rectify the situation. With Peter Sallis, Frank Thornton and Brian Murphy.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: An innocuous section of woodland soon becomes a legendary site renowned for its ghostly activity, due to the inventive rumours put about by Alvin, Truly and Clegg. Long-running comedy, starring Peter Sallis, Frank Thornton and Brian Murphy.(n)

programme.title: Ever Decreasing Circles
programme.desc: Martin plans an afternoon of activities for an elderly friend and her cronies, but he reckons without Paul's interference. Richard Briers, Penelope Wilton and Peter Egan star.(n)

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: Gordon's life appears to be in danger, with a potential assassin apparently stalking the leisure centre. However, he is far more concerned with addressing the facility's falling attendance figures. Chris Barrie stars.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher takes on the role of agony aunt and ends up writing letters home for his fellow inmates - but he soon discovers domestic problems of his own when his daughter brings bad news on visiting day. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Patricia Brake.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Miserly shopkeeper Arkwright organises a sales drive in a bid to boost profits - and rid himself of the vast consignment of apples he has mistakenly ordered. An unhappy Granville is persuaded to demonstrate the merchandise. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: Return of the sitcom about a British Pakistani family in Sparkhill, Birmingham, whose father sees himself as a pillar of the community - even if nobody else does. Mr Khan is lumbered with looking after his mother-in-law, until a miracle happens - she announces she wants to move into a home. The head of a local care centre arrives, plans are made and Khan is over the moon - until he realises his elderly relative is worth quite a bit of money. Can he stop her leaving after all? Adil Ray, Shobu Kapoor and Maya Sondhi star, with a guest appearance from Sally Lindsay.(n)

programme.title: Fawlty Towers
programme.desc: Basil's belief that guests are an obstacle to the smooth running of his hotel is borne out by the arrival of an aggressive woman (Joan Sanderson), and the tension between the two leads to a series of increasingly heated arguments. Classic comedy, starring John Cleese, Prunella Scales, Andrew Sachs and Connie Booth.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Plenty of Room in the Back.
programme.desc: After concluding she needs a new means of transport, Auntie Wainwright sends Tom and Smiler on a mission to collect her new vehicle - but it doesn't quite live up to their expectations. Jean Alexander, Tom Owen and Stephen Lewis star.(n)

Adil Ray, Shobu Kapoor and Maya Sondhi star, with a guest appearance from Sally Lindsay.(n)

programme.title: Fawlty Towers
programme.desc: Basil's belief that guests are an obstacle to the smooth running of his hotel is borne out by the arrival of an aggressive woman (Joan Sanderson), and the tension between the two leads to a series of increasingly heated arguments. Classic comedy, starring John Cleese, Prunella Scales, Andrew Sachs and Connie Booth.(n)

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Brigitte arranges a blind date for Janey with a wealthy patient's handsome son and feels obliged to deliver the birds-and-bees speech, but ends up learning a bit herself. Meanwhile, Nick pursues his own research and decides to become an artist - with the prospect of nude models in the house high on his list of priorities.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Agnes goes on a diet after her family's comments about her weight, but soon realises how difficult it will be to lay off the fish and chips. Cathy's new partner seems more interested in her mother when he visits the Brown household, and Rory has a professional dilemma after he discovers illegal drugs at work.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The day of the wedding arrives and Bryn is still behaving oddly around Stacey's brother. Nessa debates whether to share her big secret and Smithy resolves to give a superb best man's speech - but finds himself overcome with emotion under the spotlight. Mathew Horne and Joanna Page star.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Comedian Jo Brand hosts the stand-up show from the Hammersmith Apollo, introducing guest Michael McIntyre. Topics discussed include Simon Cowell and football referees.(n)

programme.title: Peep Show
programme.desc: Jeremy organises a magic mushroom party in the hope of seducing his ex-girlfriend, but his plans are threatened when Mark returns from work with gastric flu. Things go from bad to worse as Super Hans wrecks the toilet door - and the builder they contact does not seem as reliable as they would like. Robert Webb and David Mitchell star.(n)

programme.title: The Young Ones
programme.desc: Drastic measures are called for when the students are broke and Vyvyan claims to be pregnant, so Neil is forced to join the police to support them.(n)

programme.title: Blackadder
programme.desc: It is 1485 and Edmund, Duke of Edinburgh's accidental killing of his great-uncle Richard III at the Battle of Bosworth Field leads to his father becoming king. However, he also manages to help his family's arch-enemy to escape - and meets faithful sidekick Baldrick for the first time. First episode of the comedy, guest starring Peter Cook, with Rowan Atkinson and Brian Blessed.(n)

programme.title: Big School
programme.desc: Mr Gunn discovers one of the pupils could be his son, so he sets about making the boy's school days as enjoyable as possible - while Mr Church and Mr Martin battle to spread the gossip as far and wide as possible. As parents' evening arrives, the sports teacher views the event in a completely different light - while everyone else enjoys viewing Miss Postern's considerable cleavage. But the big question is - can they all get home in time for the final of The Great British Bake Off? David Walliams, Catherine Tate and Philip Glenister star in the classroom comedy.(n)

programme.title: The Smell of Reeves and Mortimer
programme.desc: Surreal humour with Vic and Bob, featuring Slade in Residence, Uncle Peter and another British Information Board film with Jack Dent and Eric Potter.(n)

programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping

programme.title: The Piglet Files
programme.desc: A woman trained to seduce Western spied and discover their secrets has Peter in her sights.(n)

programme.title: The Piglet Files
programme.desc: MI5 attempt to intercept a manuscript which could potentially leak vital information about the organisation. Nicholas Lyndhurst stars.(n)

programme.title: Ever Decreasing Circles
programme.desc: Martin's cricket team is a man short and he knows Paul is a very good player - as do the rest of the side and they all want him in, even if it means they can't play themselves. Can he bring himself to pick his arch-enemy? Comedy, starring Richard Briers and Paul Egan.(n)

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: Following his departure to Bulgaria, news of Gordon Brittas' apparent death reaches his colleagues at Whitbury Leisure Centre. However, Brittas returns from the dead to cause havoc and Carole is determined to save her baby from his zombie. Comedy, starring Chris Barrie.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Variations on a Theme of Road Rage.
programme.desc: Howard gets a bargain when he buys a used car, but the attention he gets from a burly local is more than he bargained for. Long-running comedy, starring Robert Fyfe and Peter Sallis.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: In Which Howard Gets Double Booked.
programme.desc: Howard discovers he has mistakenly agreed to take Pearl and Marina out to dinner at the same time. Long-running comedy from the pen of Roy Clarke, starring Robert Fyfe, Peter Sallis and Frank Thornton.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Will the Nearest Alien Please Come In?.
programme.desc: Truly, Clegg and Alvin try to convince science-fiction fanatic Kevin that aliens have landed nearby. Christmas edition of the long-running comedy from 1993, starring Peter Sallis, Frank Thornton and Mark Curry.(n)

programme.title: Ever Decreasing Circles
programme.desc: Martin's cricket team is a man short and he knows Paul is a very good player - as do the rest of the side and they all want him in, even if it means they can't play themselves. Can he bring himself to pick his arch-enemy? Comedy, starring Richard Briers and Paul Egan.(n)

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: Following his departure to Bulgaria, news of Gordon Brittas' apparent death reaches his colleagues at Whitbury Leisure Centre. However, Brittas returns from the dead to cause havoc and Carole is determined to save her baby from his zombie. Comedy, starring Chris Barrie.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The disappearance of an illicit tin of pineapple chunks leaves the inmates horrified that there is a thief in their midst - and for a while, no one is above suspicion. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright's day turns into a nightmare when Nurse Gladys Emmanuel has a problem with her washing machine. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Lynda Baron.(n)

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: With Shazia and Amjad's wedding fast approaching, the Khans invite the Maliks over for dinner, concerned they have never hit it off with the groom's mother - and also hope Amjad's father can help Mr Khan get onto a business committee. They pull out all the stops to impress, with Mrs Khan cooking up a storm in the kitchen, parlour games being organised, Mr Khan buying a new suit, and the couple even having a new piece of furniture to show off. But then an unexpected phone call jeopardises the event. Adil Ray and Shobu Kapoor star, with guest appearances by Ted Robbins and Colin McFarlane.(n)

programme.title: Fawlty Towers
programme.desc: Basil goes to great lengths to prove to Sybil that a guest has smuggled a woman into his room. Instead the hotelier keeps being caught in compromising situations with a young Australian woman, and a visiting psychiatrist finds his increasingly manic behaviour both fascinating and alarming. Classic comedy first broadcast in 1979, starring John Cleese and Prunella Scales.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The couple announce their engagement, prompting the Shipmans to throw a party in Billericay. Even Bryn's decision to use his sat-nav for the journey fails to dampen their spirits, and everything goes swimmingly until the conversation turns to money - and the sweethearts drop a bombshell. Mathew Horne and Joanna Page star.(n)

programme.title: Outnumbered
programme.desc: The Brockmans have to make some tough decisions about work and video games, as well as who to take to a family funeral - an event that has the vicar wishing none of them had ever come. Comedy, starring Hugh Dennis, Claire Skinner and Tyger Drew-Honey.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The newlyweds return from their honeymoon to a big welcome from both their families. However, Smithy seems disconcerted by his pal's return and Nessa makes a confession that spoils the happy occasion. Comedy, starring Mathew Horne, James Corden and Joanna Page.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Lee Mack hosts the stand-up show from the Hammersmith Apollo, introducing guest Sean Lock. Topics discussed include Riverdance, cockneys and starfish.(n)

programme.title: Peep Show
programme.desc: Mark's plans for a productive week off are disrupted by the arrival of his sister - and he becomes annoyed as Jeremy develops a crush on her. The aspiring musician gets a taste of his own medicine, however, as his flatmate admits to having feelings for Big Suze. Robert Webb and David Mitchell star.(n)

programme.title: The Young Ones
programme.desc: The lads borrow a video recorder so they can watch some video nasties, only to end up being terrorised by a vampire driving instructor. Ben Elton's anarchic comedy, starring Rik Mayall, Adrian Edmondson, Nigel Planer and Christopher Ryan, and guest starring Terry Jones, Dawn French and punk band the Damned.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: The last two semi-finalists work a shift under chef Sat Bains at his two Michelin-starred restaurant in Nottingham, before recreating one of the establishment's signature dishes of pickled and sauteed mushrooms and braised oxtail with watercress panna cotta and chive beurre noisette. They then face a third test in which they must use what they have learnt from their experience to cook a main course and a dessert for Michel Roux Jr and Monica Galetti, with only one contestant progressing to the final round.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The contestants are tasked with creating signature buns from their home regions, before Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins reveal the latest technical challenge - recreating Paul Hollywood's recipe for jam doughnuts. The showstopper task sees them baking an enriched dough loaf fit for a grand celebration, before the judges decide which bakers haven't quite risen to the challenge. From 2012.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: After six weeks of heats, 60 hopefuls have been whittled down to the most promising six. Now it's the first of the semi-finals, in which they face a big catering challenge - in Albert Square of all places. The busy EastEnders cast and crew have strictly one hour for lunch and their schedule is tight, so the two teams - serving 60 main courses and 60 desserts each from specially constructed tents - cannot be late. After that challenge it's back to the studio to come up with their own refined dish, before Gregg Wallace and John Torode send one of the hopefuls home.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers: Mums Know Best
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers investigate the nation's favourite pre-bedtime meals, discovering a recipe for a Portuguese take on fish and chips. They also examine how to make a salmon curry, and learn the formula for creating the perfect meat and potato pie.(n)

programme.title: Nigel Slater's Simple Suppers
programme.desc: The food writer provides everyday cooking advice as he transforms classic recipes, including cottage pie and apple tart, by giving them a new twist. Nigel also visits allotments and gardens around the country, where he picks up the best fresh produce to prepare his take on beans on toast.(n)

programme.title: Luke Nguyen's Street Food Asia
programme.desc: The chef travels to countries around the continent to explore their thriving street food cultures, beginning with the first of two programmes from Saigon in Vietnam.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's India
programme.desc: The chef visits a five-star hotel in Madurai, Tamil Nadu, employing local housewives for genuine home-cooked dishes and samples chettinad chicken, a dish inspired by spices brought back from both East and West by merchants. In Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh, he meets India's first MasterChef winner, and marks the end of his culinary journey with a small gathering of friends at his bungalow to reveal the outcome of his search for the perfect curry.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: The remaining chefs are asked to prove their creativity, as judges Michel Roux Jr and Monica Galetti push them to the limits of their ability. The contestants have to prepare two dishes from left-overs including meat bones, chicken carcasses, fish trimmings, vegetable peelings, stale croissants and bread, and over-ripe fruit, with the judges sending one more chef home at the end.(n)

programme.title: Destination Flavour Japan
programme.desc: Adam Liaw heads to the Tohuku region, where he goes to sea with fishermen who caught a record-breaking tuna and meets the soy-sauce maker who saved many of his staff from the 2011 tsunami.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The quarter-final of the competition sees the remaining amateur bakers tackle biscuit-based challenges. Their first task involves making a large batch of crispbreads - each of which must come up to Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood's exacting standards - before the technical challenge, in which they battle time and temperature to create a set of six chocolate teacakes. The last round sees the hopefuls baking and assembling a gingerbread house, before Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins reveal who has qualified for the 2012 semi-final - and who is going home.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The remaining five contestants enter the kitchens of Hever Castle, Kent, the childhood home of Anne Boleyn, where they cook a menu that pushes them to the limits of their abilities. With the assistance of chef John Campbell, they tackle one course each, which they have four hours to prepare, but must master elements of cuisine they have never attempted before. Their dishes are served to a group of historians - Mary Beard, Terry Deary and Lucy Worsley. Back in the studio, John Torode and Gregg Wallace set another invention test, although this time the choice of ingredients consists of scraps, leftovers and trimmings, including chicken giblets, bones, fish heads, potato peelings and stale bread. Will anyone make a pig's ear of it?.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers: Mums Know Best
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers celebrate traditional Sunday dinners, sampling the delights offered by a second-generation Italian living in east London. They also visit a mother and daughter who have come up with their own take on a regal classic, and meet a woman whose American husband relies on her culinary skill to provide him with a heart-warming taste of home.(n)

programme.title: Nigel Slater's Simple Suppers
programme.desc: The food writer shows how to make the most of simple ingredients as he prepares meatballs with grated beetroot and uses a small garden harvest to create a pudding. Nigel also continues visiting allotments around the country, and this time he heads to Kent, where he cooks vegetable fritters.(n)

programme.title: Luke Nguyen's Street Food Asia
programme.desc: Part two of two. Luke continues his Saigon adventure, uncovering a dispute between sisters with competing food stalls and cooking spicy chilli crab claws.(n)

programme.title: Next Day Air
programme.desc: An overnight shipment of drugs winds up being sent to the wrong recipient, prompting a frantic race to recover the package before the contents are discovered in this fast-paced crime comedy starring Donald Faison, Mos Def, and Mike Epps. When Brody (Epps) and Guch (Wood Harris) received package containing 10 kilos of grade-A cocaine, they assumed their financial woes were a thing of the past. The package was intended for their Brody and Guch's next-door neighbors, but the whacked-out courier (Donald Faison) delivered it to the wrong address. Recognizing the possibility for profit, the scheming duo plans to sell the cocaine to Brody's drug-dealing cousin (Omari Hardwick). Meanwhile Jesus (Cisco Reyes) and his girlfriend Chita (Yasmin Deliz), the intended recipients of the cocaine, set out to procure the package before notorious drug lord Bodego Diablo (Emilio Rivera) realizes it's gone missing. But Bodega is no slouch; he already knows the shipment was botched, and he's determined to get his drugs back no matter what the cost. Later, as Brody and Guch prepare to seal the deal that will set them up for life, the guns are drawn and the chaos begins(n)

programme.title: Beautiful Creatures
programme.desc: After falling for the new girl in town, a bookish boy discovers that her family holds a powerful and magical secret. Fantasy romance with Alice Englert and Emma Thompson(n)

programme.title: The Quest
programme.desc: Martial arts movie star Jean-Claude Van Damme made his debut behind the camera as the director of this sweeping action drama. Van Damme stars as Chris Dubois, a clown pickpocket and Fagin-like leader of orphan thieves in 1925 New York City. Kidnapped by gun smugglers and then sold to pirate captain Lord Dobbs (Roger Moore), Chris eventually ends up the property of Khao (Aki Aleong), a master Asian kickboxer. His fighting skills win Chris a chance at a legendary contest, a gladiatorial showdown between champions of the world's many diverse combat styles in a Tibetan lost city. Along for the trip are the avaricious Dobbs, heavyweight boxing champ and fellow competitor Maxie (James Remar), and Carrie (Janet Gunn), a beautiful female reporter(n)

programme.title: Risky Business
programme.desc: Tom Cruise, in his breakthrough role, stars as a straight-A student left in charge of the house by his holidaying parents. Grabbing the Porsche, he heads downtown and picks up glamorous hooker Rebecca De Mornay. She's on the run from her pimp and when she sees Cruise's house, she has an idea - seduce him and persuade him to turn it into a high class bordello for just one night, so she and her friends can relieve his friends of their cash. All goes well until her pimp turns up looking for payback in Paul Brickman's sex comedy that rises above the genre to be both entertaining and provoking. Also starring Joe Pantoliano and Bronson Pinchot(n)

programme.title: Midnight Special
programme.desc: In this cryptic sci-fi adventure from writer/director Jeff Nichols, Roy (Michael Shannon) rescues his son Alton (Jaeden Lieberher) from a religious cult in Texas, whose members worship the boy for his supernatural powers. Along with a state trooper (Joel Edgerton), the pair go on a cross-country journey as they are hunted by federal agents, who believe Alton might be a threat to national security. Kirsten Dunst, Adam Driver, and Sam Shepard co-star(n)

programme.desc: Four years after they left school, three old pals team up for a road trip from Georgia to California. Mimi's got dreams of Hollywood, Kit's looking forward to seeing her beau, but Lucy wants escape...and maybe to find the mother she's never met(n)

programme.title: The Bodyguard
programme.desc: When beautiful superstar singer Rachel Marron (Houston) receives death threats, she hires Frank Farmer (Costner), the best bodyguard in the business. Haunted by a prior failure to stop an assassin's bullet, Farmer will let nothing and no one stop him from protecting his charge--until he breaks the cardinal rule of his profession by falling in love with his client(n)

programme.title: The Normal Heart
programme.desc: Mark Ruffalo and Julia Roberts star in a powerful drama, based on Larry Kramer's groundbreaking play, about the outbreak of HIV/Aids(n)

programme.title: Speed Racer
programme.desc: The Matrix masterminds Andy and Larry Wachowski usher anime icon Tatsuo Yoshida's classic 1960s-era hit into the new millennium with this family-friendly story of a young racecar driver who takes on the mysterious Racer X in a custom-made, gadget-loaded speed machine named the Mach 5. Speed Racer (Emile Hirsch) is the kind of driver that every wheelman wishes he could be: a born winner whose unbeatable combination of aggression, instinct, and fearlessness always finds him crossing the checkered flag with a comfortable lead. In Speed Racer's mind, the only driver who could present him with any real challenge is his late brother -- the legendary Rex Racer. Rex died in a heated cross-country rally known as The Crucible many years ago, and now his younger sibling is driven to fulfill the legacy that Rex left behind. To this day, Speed Racer is fiercely loyal to family. It was Speed Racer's father, Pops Racer (John Goodman), who designed the unbeatable Mach 5, and even a lucrative offer from racing giants Royalton Industries isn't enough to get the young ace to break his family ties. Upon turning down Royalton's (Roger Allam) astronomical offer, Speed Racer makes the shocking discovery that the outcomes of the biggest races are being predetermined by a handful of powerful moguls who pad their profits by manipulating the drivers. Realizing that his career would be ruined if word of the fix gets out, Royalton vows that the Mach 5 will never make it to another finish line. Now, the only way for Speed Racer to save the family business and beat Royalton at his own game will be to win the very same race that claimed his brother's life so many years ago. In order to accomplish that formidable feat, however, Speed Racer will not only have to rely on his family and the aid of his longtime girlfriend, Trixie (Christina Ricci), but form a tenuous alliance with his longtime rival -- the mysterious Racer X (Matthew Fox) -- as well(n)

programme.title: War Dogs
programme.desc: Two down-on-their-luck pals become arms dealers, but get in over their heads when they land a $300 million contract with the U.S. government to supply weaponry to forces in Afghanistan. Based on true events(n)

programme.title: Crimson Peak
programme.desc: A mysterious stranger woos and transports a young woman to a crumbling dwelling atop a clay mountain, where she soon learns he has many secrets in the haunted mansion that will leave her fighting for her sanity and her very life(n)

programme.title: Be Cool
programme.desc: John Travolta is back as Mafia loanshark turned Hollywood Producer Chili Palmer in this sequel to GET SHORTY. This time, Chili finds himself mixing it up in the rough and tumble world of rock stars, pop divas, and hip hop gangstas when a new idea for a movie leads him into the music business. Will his wise guy attitude succeed in the ever-changing world of music or will more people just end up dead?(n)

programme.title: Shaft
programme.desc: Dynamic Samuel L. Jackson stars as New York City cop John Shaft, who quits the force and decides to dispense his own brand of vigilante justice against a racist killer (Christian Bale) and a Dominican drug lord (Jeffrey Wright). Richard Roundtree, who played the original John Shaft in three '70s crime dramas, has a cameo as Jackson's uncle and namesake. Busta Rhymes, Vanessa Williams, Dan Hedaya(n)

programme.title: The Defiant Ones
programme.desc: Part 1. Premiere of a four-part documentary series spotlighting the unlikely, but durable partnership between music producer Jimmy Iovine and rapper Dr. Dre. The opener follows Dre's story in Compton, Cal., and his fascination with dance music and Iovine's early days in Brooklyn(n)

programme.title: The Defiant Ones
programme.desc: Part 2. Part 2 of 4. N.W.A. evolves into a musical force but personal losses, a bitter contract dispute and a clash over management strain Dre's relationship with Easy-E. Meanwhile, Jimmy collaborates with Tom Petty, Stevie Nicks and U2(n)

programme.title: Vice
programme.desc: Power to the President. Isobel Yeung reports from Turkey as citizens head to the polls in a nationwide referendum that grants President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan unprecedented power(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Dragonstone. In the Season 7 premiere, Jon organizes the defense of the North; Cersei seeks to even the odds; and Daenerys comes home(n)

programme.title: Tour de Pharmacy
programme.desc: Sports-doping spoof focusing on a fictional, world-class cycling event in 1982 that was marred by one controversy after another, as recalled by five riders, commentators, celebrities and other assorted ne'er-do-wells(n)

programme.title: War Dogs
programme.desc: Two down-on-their-luck pals become arms dealers, but get in over their heads when they land a $300 million contract with the U.S. government to supply weaponry to forces in Afghanistan. Based on true events(n)

programme.title: Crimson Peak
programme.desc: A mysterious stranger woos and transports a young woman to a crumbling dwelling atop a clay mountain, where she soon learns he has many secrets in the haunted mansion that will leave her fighting for her sanity and her very life(n)

programme.title: Batman Returns
programme.desc: Tim Burton's sequel pits the Caped Crusader against the Penguin and Catwoman(n)

programme.title: Men in Black II
programme.desc: Alien-hunting agents hunt extraterrestrials bent on destroying Earth in this sequel(n)

programme.title: Miss Peregrine's Home for Peculiar Children
programme.desc: After a family tragedy, a boy follows a series of clues that lead him to a mysterious orphanage on a remote Welsh island. There, he discovers a community of children with unusual abilities(n)

programme.title: Unbreakable
programme.desc: Director M. Night Shyamalan followed the chilling "The Sixth Sense" with this riveting thriller. Bruce Willis is security guard David Dunn, who survives a devastating train wreck miraculously unharmed. The owner (Samuel L. Jackson) of a comic-book art gallery sees him as a mysterious protector with a higher calling, but Dunn is doubtful. Robin Wright Penn, Spencer Treat Clark, Eamonn Walker(n)

programme.title: Central Intelligence
programme.desc: An accountant is pulled into the deadly world of espionage by his former nerdy classmate who is now a CIA assassin(n)

programme.title: HBO First Look: 'War for the Planet of the Apes'
programme.desc: A look at "War for the Planet of the Apes," a 2017 thriller about an ape army's struggle against homo sapiens. The film stars Andy Serkis, Woody Harrelson and Steve Zahn, and is directed by Matt Reeves(n)

programme.title: The Accountant
programme.desc: A math genius works as a financial consultant for criminal organizations in this intelligent thriller. While being investigated by the Treasury Department, he agrees to help an accounting clerk look into fraud at her company, but the assignment will prove far more dangerous than he could have ever anticipated(n)

programme.title: Unfaithful
programme.desc: Connie Sumner begins a torrid affair with book dealer Paul Martel after he helps her bandage a wounded knee. But how long can she keep him a secret, before her guilt and her husband's suspicion end the affair?(n)

programme.title: Shakespeare in Love
programme.desc: Tom Stoppard provided the witty and intelligent script for John Madden's romantic comedy in which young Will Shakespeare struggles with writer's block and money worries while trying to complete Romeo and Ethel: The Pirate's Daughter. Gwyneth Paltrow once more employs her faultless English accent, playing aristocratic Viola de Lesseps, who is shortly to be married off but yearns to slum it as an actor. Disguising herself as a boy in order to be allowed on stage, Viola becomes Will's muse, and the more familiar tale of Romeo and Juliet begins to take shape as the couple fall passionately in love. The film is littered with knowing lines and energetically supported by a stellar cast, including Judy Dench as Queen Elizabeth - a cameo performance which earned her one of the movie's seven Oscars(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Dragonstone. In the Season 7 premiere, Jon organizes the defense of the North; Cersei seeks to even the odds; and Daenerys comes home(n)

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: Hooli-Con. Erlich goes on a trip to get his mojo back while the guys head to Hooli-Con, where Jared faces a moral dilemma; Gilfoyle and Dinesh are distracted by Keenan; and Richard becomes obsessed with an ex's new beau(n)

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: Server Error. In the Season 4 finale, Richard's caught in a web of lies in a last-ditch attempt to save Pied Piper. Meanwhile, Jared plans his exit when he's worried about Richard's future; Jack tries to change the narrative; and Gavin plots his comeback(n)

programme.title: Harold & Kumar Escape From Guantanamo Bay
programme.desc: Friends Harold and Kumar decide to take a trip to Amsterdam when Harold finds out that his beloved Maria is heading to the city. After a few incidents at the airport, they finally get on the plane, but once again create more trouble when Kumar lights up his new bong and the air marshals think it's a bomb. Next stop: Guantanamo Bay prison, in Cuba. And the problems have just started..(n)

programme.title: Boxing After Dark
programme.desc: Miguel Berchelt (31-1, 28 KOs) takes on Takashi Miura (31-3-2, 24 KOs) in a super-featherweight bout in Inglewood, Cal. Also: Jezreel Corrales vs. Robinson Castellanos in a super-featherweight contest(n)

programme.title: Serendipity

Instead of swapping numbers, she takes his number on a five dollar bill, then spends it. Romantic comedy(n)

Initially seduced by the money and lifestyle, he soon becomes troubled by the unusual and aggressive behaviour of his new employers(n)

programme.desc: Three rockers, Chazz, Rex and Pip, try to get their demo played on a radio station, but when they are rudely turned down things quickly escalate!(n)

programme.desc: In this big-screen continuation of the popular British sitcom, hard-living ladies Edina and Patsy flee to the French Riviera after an incident at a fashionable event causes them to be hounded by the paparazzi(n)

programme.title: Central Intelligence
programme.desc: An accountant is pulled into the deadly world of espionage by his former nerdy classmate who is now a CIA assassin(n)

programme.title: Rush Hour 3
programme.desc: Brett Ratner's martial-arts action-comedy sequel starring Chris Tucker and Jackie Chan. When the Chinese Ambassador to the US is shot while in the act of divulging the whereabouts of a major Triad leader, the American authorities once more send Chief Inspector Lee and Detective James Carter into the fray. Lee quickly corners the would-be assassin, Kenji, but the shock of coming face-to-face with an old friend gives the baddie just enough time to escape. Kenji's trail leads the mismatched cops to Paris, where car chases and a sequence among the under-dressed dancers of the Folies Bergère await them, plus rather a lot of dodgy French stereotypes and a finale atop the Eiffel Tower(n)

programme.title: Rat Race
programme.desc: Gag-meister Jerry Zucker serves up another cracking comedy with a cast to die for. Las Vegas casino owner Donald P Sinclair decides to set up a special event for his highest rollers. Lucky tokens in his slot machines entitle six punters to enter a race across America with $2 million as the prize. He'll make a killing on the bets placed on the players while the contestants dash for the cash(n)

programme.title: Just Married
programme.desc: Loved-up newlyweds, Sarah and Tom, experience the honeymoon from hell when her disapproving family dispatch Sarah's ex-boyfriend to undo the marital knot(n)

programme.title: Making of 'Absolutely Fabulous: The Movie'
programme.desc: A look at "Absolutely Fabulous: The Movie," a 2016 adaptation of the popular British sitcom about hard-living ladies Edina and Patsy, who flee to the French Riviera after they accidentally cause the death of a celebrity at a posh party. The film stars Jennifer Saunders and Joanna Lumley, and is directed by Mandie Fletcher(n)

programme.title: Cake
programme.desc: A wedding-wary writer takes over the reigns of her father's bridal magazine, where she meets two men who cause her to rethink her position on marriage(n)

programme.title: Legal Eagles
programme.desc: FILM DA Tom Logan is set for higher office, at least until he becomes involved with defence lawyer Laura Kelly and her unpredictable client(n)

programme.title: Sister Act 2: Back in the Habit
programme.desc: Whoopi Goldberg returns to the calling, as a singer helping the nuns run an inner-city school(n)

programme.title: Tracey Ullman: Live & Exposed
programme.desc: The multitalented performer sings, dances and walks down memory lane in an autobiographical show that revisits some of her most famous alter egos, including makeup artist Ruby Romaine, veteran actress Linda Granger and Long Island housewife Fern Rosenthal. Taped in Los Angeles at the Henry Ford Theatre in February 2005(n)

programme.desc: After a freak accident causes all the tapes in a video store to be erased, an employee and his pal decide to make their own no-budget re-creations of various movies. Jack Black and Mos Def star in this sweet and surreal fable from director Michel Gondry ("The Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind"). Danny Glover, Mia Farrow, Melonie Diaz, Sigourney Weaver(n)

programme.title: Fast Times at Ridgemont High
programme.desc: Director Amy Heckerling's hilarious teen movie follows brother and sister Brad and Stacy through a world of dead-end jobs, uninspiring classes, borrowed cars and sexual anxiety. Sean Penn is unforgettable as a stoned surfer(n)

programme.title: Life with Mikey
programme.desc: Mikey used to be a child star. These days, he's just a talent scout looking for kids with prospects, until pint-sized Angie picks his pocket. Mikey hears her sob story and sees his ticket back to the big time. Family comedy(n)

programme.title: Sister Act
programme.desc: Wacky comedy about a singer who witnesses a murder and goes undercover as a nun. In the convent she is put in charge of coaching the choir, which she transforms into a toe-tapping rhythm group. As a result, the church's congregation swells until even the Pope comes to witness pop classics such as 'My Guy' performed to glorify the Lord. But, of course, her fame gives away her hiding place to the killer(n)

programme.desc: The Frog Prince. What ever will princess Ebony do without the friends she so desperately wants? Her father, the king, has given her everything he can, except for friends she can call her own. This modernized fable finds the African-American princess Ebony kissing frogs in hopes of finding friends her own age. You'll notice the tale focuses on the princess finding true friends rather than true love, teaching the value of friendship. In the end, the enchanted frog teaches Ebony the meaning of being a friend. Danny Glover and Sinbad lend a hand in telling this yarn(n)
