programme.title: Space Chimps
programme.desc: In Kirk DeMicco's animated film three supersonic simian spacemen take to the cosmos to find a missing probe, and encounter a whole world of trouble along the way. Ham III, the grandson of the first ever chimp in space, is a wise-cracking smart aleck who makes a living being fired from a cannon. When the Infinity Space Probe goes missing, Ham joins a mission to find it. He's been recruited as a PR stunt, but his fellow Space Chimps, Luna and Titan, are highly trained experts. When they crash-land on the planet Malgor, they find a race of aliens who are being oppressed by the tyrannical Zartog, who is using the probe for his own nefarious ends. Can the feckless Ham use his circus skills to save the day, help liberate the aliens, recover the probe, get the girl, and find a way to get back home? This is great fare for all the family, with plenty of deadpan asides to keep grown-ups entertained(n)

Now, as well as facing the computer's weaponry, they must tackle the living dead to prevent the virus escaping into the outside world. Paul W Anderson's horror thriller is based on the successful computer game(n)

programme.title: Presumed Innocent
programme.desc: Harrison Ford gives an intense, brooding performance as District Attorney Rusty Sabich in the late Alan J Pakula's lugubrious adaptation of Scott Turow's best-selling mystery novel. Assigned to investigate the brutal rape and murder of his legal colleague and one-time lover Carolyn Polhemus, Sabich's life is turned upside-down when all the evidence uncovered points to him being the killer(n)

programme.title: Martin Lawrence Live: Runteldat
programme.desc: Martin Lawrence is one of America's top black comedians, spoken of in the same breath as the late Richard Pryor and Eddie Murphy when they were at the height of their stand-up powers, and he's also appeared in films including Big Momma's House and Bad Boys. But he's also suffered setbacks in his personal life, from being arrested with a loaded gun at an airport to being accused by his co-star in the TV show Martin of sexual harassment. In this outstanding film of his stand-up routine, he confronts his demons and those who demonise him, as well as veering off to his favourite subject: women, and how hard they are to live with. And 'rundletat' is short for 'run and tell that'(n)

programme.title: Towelhead
programme.desc: Six Feet Under creator and American Beauty screenwriter Alan Ball makes his feature directorial debut with this screen adaptation of author Alicia Erian's controversial novel Towelhead. Jasira (Summer Bishil) is a 13-year-old Arab-American who's contending with the pains of adolescence when her life takes a sudden and unexpected turn. Sent to live with her stern Lebanese father, Rifat (Peter Macdissi), by her self-absorbed mother (Maria Bello), Jasira finds herself struggling to adjust to life in the suburbs while contending with racism and hypocrisy at every turn. Rifat lives in a modest, suburban Houston home next to racist reservist Mr. Vuoso (Aaron Eckhart) and meddling expectant mother Melina (Toni Collette). Adjusting to life in the suburbs isn't easy for young Jasira, though she tries her hardest to adapt to the unfamiliar environment by striking up casual conversations with her curious new neighbors. In the process, Jasira finds herself increasingly attracted to hormone-driven African-American teen Thomas (Eugene Jones). When Rifat finds out that his daughter's new boyfriend is black, he vehemently condemns the relationship. As America launches its initial invasion of Iraq, Jasira finds herself caught up in a potentially explosive situation that is only compounded by her raging hormones and the snooping of her pregnant, busybody neighbor(n)

programme.title: Heartburn
programme.desc: Jack Nicholson and Meryl Streep star as husband and wife journalists in the hothouse of Washington politics whose marriage slowly goes awry under the pressures of their careers and his philanderings in Mike Nichols' film from Nora Ephron's screenplay and based on the real-life experience of her marriage to Watergate journalist Carl Woodward(n)

When Peter leaves town, she and her best friend hit the road so Christina can win his heart. Christina Applegate, Selma Blair, Parker Posey(n)

programme.title: The Brothers Bloom
programme.desc: Wonderful chemistry among leads Adrien Brody, Mark Ruffalo and Rachel Weisz sparks this enthralling caper comedy. The guys play sibling con men who are out to make a multi-million-dollar score, and Weisz portrays their victim, a kooky heiress they string along until complications, like she and Brody falling in love, put a hitch in their plan. Rinko Kikuchi is a blast as a demolition expert, "an artist with nitroglycerin," they employ as part of their sting. Robbie Coltrane, Maximilian Schell(n)

programme.title: Suicide Squad

programme.title: The Happening
programme.desc: Lady in the Water director M. Night Shyamalan puts PG-13 suspense on pause to tell this grim apocalyptic tale about a family fleeing a natural disaster that poses a grave threat to the whole of humanity. Philadelphia high-school science teacher Elliot Moore (Mark Wahlberg) is discussing the disappearance of the bees with his students when the staff is summoned to the theater and briefed about a mysterious event that is currently unfolding in New York City. According to reports, citizens in the vicinity of Central Park have suddenly and inexplicably begun seizing up just before killing themselves by whatever means are at their disposal. As the phenomena begins to spread and talk of terrorism fills the airwaves, Elliot, his wife, Alma (Zooey Deschanel), their friend Julian (John Leguizamo), and his daughter, Jess (Ashlyn Sanchez), board a train bound for the presumed safety of the country. When the train screeches to a halt before arriving at its final destination, however, the frightened passengers are forced to fend for themselves as each consecutive news report paints an increasingly grim picture of the situation in more urbanized areas. Theories abound on what could be causing the unexplainable rash of suicides, but the only thing that everyone seems to agree on is that it's some kind of airborne contagion that is carried in the wind. It would appear that humankind's reign on planet Earth has come to an end, but perhaps if this small band of survivors can find a safe place to lie low until this all blows over, all hope for survival of the species might not be lost just yet(n)

programme.title: Mission: Impossible II
programme.desc: Director John Woo brings Hong Kong-style martial arts action to this comic book-flavored sequel that eschews the complicated plot and political maneuverings of its predecessor in favor of pure, adrenaline-charged thrills. Tom Cruise returns as Ethan Hunt, an operative for the top-secret government agency IMF (Impossible Missions Force). Fellow agent Sean Ambrose (Dougray Scott) has gone rogue, stealing a sample of a deadly synthetic virus named Chimera that could rapidly wipe out the world's population. Ambrose's plan is to sell Chimera to the highest bidder in exchange for shares of stock in the winner's company. Summoned by the new IMF chief (Anthony Hopkins in an uncredited cameo role), Ethan is assigned to recruit the help of Ambrose's former lover Nyah Nordoff-Hall (Thandie Newton), a gorgeous woman who left Ambrose broken-hearted and who may be able to quickly regain his confidence. Once he meets and spends a night with Nyah, however, Ethan is smitten, and now must both capture Ambrose and keep Nyah alive as she infiltrates a nest of vipers. Sophisticated disguises, gun battles, and high-speed chases are the order of the day, very much in the James Bond mold. Mission: Impossible 2 is based on a story by Star Trek: The Next Generation writers Ronald D. Moore and Brannon Braga, with a script polish by Robert Towne(n)

Investigating the bizarre attempts against Natalie's life, Monk (Tony Shalhoub) discovers that all the weapons used were made in Chechnya, leading him to the proverbial Most Likely Suspect. So now Monk knows who wants to see Natalie dead...but he still doesn't know why!(n)

programme.title: Garage Sale Mystery: The Deadly Room

The scientists believe that they are about to uncover Coronado's fabled "City of Gold"; instead, they unearth a corpse of more recent vintage. programme.title: Monk
programme.desc: Mr. Monk and the Kid. Adrian Monk is a highly gifted detective whose career is jeopardised by his overwhelming fear of germs, crowds, small places, and almost everything else...(although he's making progress on milk). Monk's disorder was triggered by the murder of his beloved wife, Trudy, which continues to haunt him as the only unsolved mystery in his career. Ordered to take a leave of absence from the police department, Monk hires Sharona, a nurse who helps him try to get reinstated on the force, and in the process, becomes an unlikely Dr. Watson to his Sherlock Holmes. When the police department find themselves unable to crack a high-profile case, they have no choice but to bring back the only man for the job...phobias and all(n)

programme.title: Revenge of the Nerds
programme.desc: Revenge of the Nerds is the juvenile sex comedy perhaps most synonymous with the 1980s, alternating gags and scantily clad women with a power to the underdogs mentality that prompted three sequels. The handsome jocks of Alpha Beta, led by Stan (Ted McGinley), run Adams College, which means that when they burn down their house after a stunt involving grain alcohol and an open flame, they kick a bunch of socially inept freshman out of their dorm and into the gymnasium. But sleeping on cots is only the beginning of their worries, as the so-called nerds soon become the target of pranks by Alpha Beta, assisted by Betty (Julie Montgomery) and the gorgeous gals of Pi Delta Pi. Instead of taking the abuse sitting down, the displaced freshman, led by Gilbert (Anthony Edwards) and Lewis (Robert Carradine), buy a ramshackle house, affiliate themselves with the only national chapter who will take them (the all-black Lambda Lambda Lambda), and use their superior intellect to launch a counterstrike. The bespectacled but loveable geeks set up surveillance cameras in the Pi bathroom and put liquid heat in the athletes' jock straps, then draft a sister sorority of misfits (Omega Mu) to strengthen their resources. The frats quickly become bitter rivals, and the goal is to win the annual fraternity decathlon, which involves such feats as a burping contest and a go-cart race, with bragging rights (and perhaps peace of mind) at stake. Look for John Goodman and future thirtysomething cast member Timothy Busfield in small roles, and expect a torrent of nasal laughter(n)

programme.desc: The thriller reaches a dramatic conclusion as Emma tries to finally uncover the truth, and Heather reassures Matthew that nothing connects the evidence to Linda's death. However, with pressure mounting, Kretchmer isn't so convinced and urges Heather to stay in the UK to fix the situation, while DCS Greenwood tracks down the mother of Rachel Leigh, Linda's friend and the last person known to see her alive. Visiting her in a nursing home in London, Emma hopes that she may be able to give her the final piece of the puzzle. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Killer Women with Piers Morgan
programme.desc: Piers travels to Gadsden Correctional Facility near Tallahassee in Florida, where he hears the story of Ashley Humphrey. As a 20-year-old in 2003, she pumped eight bullets into barmaid Sandee Rozzo - a crime for which she is now serving 25 years. Piers tries to understand how she came to commit the crime, wondering whether she was persuaded by her domineering and abusive husband - who was being accused of rape by the victim - or if she is simply a cold-blooded killer who came up with the plan herself.(n)

programme.desc: Members of the Midsomer-in-the-Marsh Ornithological Society fall out when Ralph Ford claims to have spotted a blue-crested hoopoe, meaning he wins the group's year-listing competition. However, their president Patrick Morgan says the rare species could never have been seen so far away from its native Uganda and brands him a cheat. The next day, Barnaby and Jones have a murder case on their hands when Patrick is found dead at the scene of the reported sighting. Guest starring Paul Nicholls and James Dreyfus.(n)

programme.title: Davina McCall: Life at the Extreme
programme.desc: Davina travels to the Norwegian archipelago of Svalbard in the Arctic Circle, a harsh environment set across 15 million sq km of sea ice where temperatures can drop to -40C. She learns how huskies' thick fur is better insulation than goose down, that the deep pads on their paws protect them from the cold and their almond shaped eyes mean they are less exposed in a blizzard. She also tracks a polar bear to the open sea and witnesses bearded seals using their whiskers like feelers to find shrimp and crab on the ocean floor.(n)

Crime drama, guest starring Iain Glen.(n)

However, they discover the killing was copied straight from the pages of a popular fantasy novel written by an Oxford tutor, suggesting it may be the work of a crazed fan - or something even more sinister. Guest starring Art Malik, Tom Mison and James Fox, father of Laurence.(n)

programme.title: Benidorm
programme.desc: When hunky Jason Gallagher (former Brookside star Philip Olivier) turns up at the Solana looking for work, Mateo gives him short shrift, telling him there are no jobs available. However, when the barman skives off, the newcomer seizes the opportunity to stand in for him without permission, and quickly attracts a crowd with his cocktail-making skills. Manager Joyce is impressed and offers him a week's trial, but Mateo is soon battling to reclaim the limelight. Meanwhile, Tiger leads Michael astray by persuading him to help steal the hotel's all-inclusive wristbands and sell them in town.(n)

programme.title: Passenger 57
programme.desc: After his wife is shot dead during a robbery, a cop hands in his badge and takes up a job offer from an old friend to be a security adviser for a major transatlantic airline. On the flight taking him to his new employers in Los Angeles is an international terrorist being escorted to trial by the FBI - while the prisoner's accomplices are disguised as passengers and crew and plan to hijack the plane. Action thriller, with Wesley Snipes, Bruce Payne, Tom Sizemore, Alex Datcher, Bruce Greenwood and Elizabeth Hurley.(n)

programme.desc: The dapper Belgian sleuth goes on an Egyptian cruise on board an old steamer, but when an American heiress is murdered, his little grey cells go into overdrive. David Suchet stars, with James Fox, Judy Parfitt, Emily Blunt, Daisy Donovan, Frances de la Tour and David Soul.(n)

programme.title: The Grand
programme.desc: Ruth is thrown into jeopardy by an unexpected appointment as Stephen and Kate begin their new life. Period drama, starring Victoria Scarborough and Ifan Meredith.(n)

programme.title: Lillie
programme.desc: Famous actress Sarah Bernhardt threatens Lillie's position as mistress to the Prince of Wales. Francesca Annis stars.(n)

programme.title: Robin of Sherwood
programme.desc: The sheriff captures Much the miller's son and threatens to hang him, and an ageing outlaw kidnap's the tyrant's nephew. Drama, starring Jason Coney.(n)

programme.title: Outside Edge
programme.desc: A pile of manure is dumped on the pitch and Maggie and Kevin argue over her sister. Cricketing comedy drama, starring Brenda Blethyn, Robert Daws, Timothy Spall and Josie Lawrence.(n)

programme.title: Outside Edge
programme.desc: Fred collapses with a heart attack just moments away from a memorable victory on the pitch. Cricketing comedy drama, starring Brenda Blethyn, Robert Daws, Timothy Spall and Josie Lawrence.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick is left with a sore head following an incident in a graveyard, and Blaketon experiences trouble at home. Rural drama, starring Nick Berry and Derek Fowlds.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: A captivating French countess claims to know Richard and obtains an invitation to dinner. Believing her to be wealthy, the servants encourage the match, but things are not quite as they seem.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Christine flies in the face of medical ethics while trying to help a teenage rent-boy with syphilis, and when he runs away before being treated, she spends her night off scouring the streets for him. Mike's ex-wife announces she wants custody of the boys, while Louise, worried she might be pregnant, throws herself into her work - only to face constant reminders in the shape of expectant mothers and poorly children.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.sub-title: The Mystery of the Blue Train.
programme.desc: The sleuth finds himself in interesting company as English socialites and American millionaires rub shoulders on board a train bound for the French Riviera. Passengers include oil magnate Rufus Van Aldin (Elliott Gould) and his daughter Ruth (Jaime Murray) - to whom he has given a magnificent ruby known as the Heart of Fire. With members of the aristocracy crammed into a confined space with their husbands, lovers and a renowned gemstone, murder cannot be far away. With Lindsay Duncan, Roger Lloyd Pack and James D'Arcy.(n)

programme.title: Cold Feet
programme.desc: The comedy drama about a group of friends returns after a break of more than 13 years, catching up with the lives of Adam Williams, David and Karen Marsden and Pete and Jenny Gifford. The gang is reunited when Adam turns up in Manchester to announce his impending marriage, but not everyone is as thrilled as he is. Without the blessing of his friends and family, Adam begins to have doubts. Starring John Thomson, James Nesbitt, Fay Ripley, Hermione Norris and Robert Bathurst.(n)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: Crime drama starring Brenda Blethyn. The detective investigates a fire that rips through a holiday park on the Northumberland coast, destroying three cabins. A young woman's body is discovered and the resort's owner, Jim Viner, fears the victim is his sister Deena when he returns from a weekend away with his daughter Clare. With Jim's suspicions confirmed, a police report then reveals Clare's boyfriend Ryan and his friends had been partying near the scene hours before the blaze started, but where are they now, and where is Deena's best friend Sally? Co-starring Kenny Doughty, Cush Jumbo and Jon Morrison.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: A man is caught on camera abusing a dog, and a horse needs help after collapsing.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Chief Investigator Boller visits a livestock auction, where he rescues horses from slaughter by outbidding buyers from meat markets.(n)

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of mother-of-three Patty Vaughan, whose blood-stained minivan was found abandoned at a roadside on Christmas Day 1996, 20 miles from her home in Texas. Police considered the possible involvement of her ex-husband in her disappearance.(n)

programme.title: Corrupt Crimes
programme.desc: A small town judge who went down a dark path of revenge and murder, leaving an entire town in fear. Plus, Democratic American Congressman Jesse Jackson Jr, whose legacy crashed and burned amid scandal.(n)

programme.title: Corrupt Crimes

programme.desc: The crimes of Co Derry dentist Colin Howell, who in 2009 admitted gassing to death his first wife Lesley and the policeman husband of his mistress 18 years earlier.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps Ali Harris and Steve Ashby from Poole to fulfil their dream of retiring to Italy to run a very English B&B, with the couple having a budget of £100,000.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A boxer dog is brought in with extensive injuries to its pelvis and hind legs from a road accident. Pioneering surgeon Noel Fitzpatrick considers a stem-cell scaffolding procedure - but there are significant risks attached. He and his team also help different animals with broken legs, including hedgehogs, and a kitten that has had an accident at home.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at the Shelley Guest House in Aberystwyth, where its husband-and-wife owners hope to prove that their establishment offers the best value for money by providing their guests with an old-school form of entertainment, some Spanish cuisine and a monumental continental breakfast.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guests travel to the five-star Ixworth House in Bury St Edmunds, Suffolk, where hosts John and Sharyn Snell are quietly confident their establishment will impress. John reveals his hidden talents at dinner, but his performance at breakfast the next morning does not go down well with all of the fellow B&B owners.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: In York, part-time panto dame Graham Smith runs the Georgian House & Mews, and takes his guests back in time with a Nordic test of strength. At supper, Hazel has romance on her mind, but the guests are left to fend for themselves at breakfast - until Graham makes a show-stopping appearance.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to the George Hotel in Orton, Cumbria, for the fourth visit of the day. Owner Hazel McAleese organises a fishing trip as the afternoon activity, during which one of the guests decides to use the opportunity to give everyone a lesson in innuendo.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants featured throughout the contest reunite to revisit the highs and lows of their various stays, and as the B&B owners confront their critics face to face, they discover what the rival parties really thought of the quality of service they encountered. After the deliberations are over, the winning guest house is announced.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin searches Lot-et-Garonne in the south west of France for Karen Wright and Philip Johnston, who dream of retiring to the country. They have £100,000, but that isn't just for them. The property needs to be large enough for their five dogs - and to accommodate even more as they have a dream of fostering rescue pooches.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Property expert Jasmine Harman helps Steph Fessey and Andy Wynn from Hampshire search for a property on Portugal's Silver Coast within a budget of £100,000. The couple are looking for a house with a spacious garden for when their children and grandchildren visit, as well as views of the countryside.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team search for the remains of a Norman castle in Dundrum, Co Down, one of Northern Ireland's most picturesque counties, exploring a territory established by renegade knight John de Courcy in the 12th century against the orders of King John. The castle was later rebuilt, and much of its replacement is still standing, but the experts are convinced that some of what remains dates from de Courcy's time - and discover that it may go back even further.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team try to piece together the complete picture of the Manor of the More, a once impressive structure masterminded by Henry VIII's right-hand man, Cardinal Wolsey. The palace had been forgotten about until the 1950s, when a group of pupils at Northwood School in Hertfordshire discovered its remains beneath a playing field. One of them joins the team on an adventure of discovery, observing remains dating back to the 16th century.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Presenter Tim Shaw and mechanic Fuzz Townshend head to Plymouth to rescue a 25-year-old example of the world's bestselling two-seater sports car - the Mazda MX5.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Expats Dave and Sue arrive at the surgery after a 500-mile trip from France to bring their border collie Kaspar, who has a leg pain that is proving hard to diagnose. An eight-year-old pug needs surgery on its elbow, and an Egyptian Mau cat is rushed into Fitzpatrick's after fracturing its knee in a fall from a second-floor balcony. Noel goes ahead with surgery on the complex fracture, but if there are any complications the kitten may face amputation.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: More than a decade ago, Kevin McCloud visited Brighton to meet a co-operative of 10 families, including former travellers and single parents, who were building their own and each other's homes, with the promise that the council would allow them to live in the finished properties at a reduced rent. For two years they laboured, balancing a 30-hour week with various other commitments. Now the presenter returns to see whether the houses, and the community that built them, have stood the test of time.(n)

programme.title: Dunkirk: The New Evidence
programme.desc: Documentary examining the famous Second World War evacuation of Allied soldiers - codenamed Operation Dynamo - from the beaches of Dunkirk, France, between May 26 and June 4, 1940. Recently released Ministry of Defence files reveal that, far from being absent as many historians have believed, the RAF was suffering massive losses supporting the evacuation. Operating at high altitude and deep inside France, RAF planes were halting the bulk of Luftwaffe bombers before they could reach the beaches. The files also reveal that the famous Spitfire took flight for the first time during the mission, and the agile fighter was a spectacular success.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Aaron, 31, is rushed to St George's after overturning his car onto metal railings during a high-speed collision. He has a serious laceration to his face where a spiked railing narrowly missed his eye socket. Cameras also follow Fiona, 65, who is rushed to the hospital after falling over in a restaurant and cutting her knee during her friend Evelyn's 70th birthday party.(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: The challenges faced by emergency services on the roads, revealing how new technology can detect people driving under the influence of drugs, leading to a rise in convictions. A woman is found to be over the limit while driving only a few streets away from her home. Emergency services personnel reveal the problems they have when dealing with elderly motorists who may no longer be able to drive safely, and how responding to an incident can have lasting repercussions.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The fiery chef tries to change the fortunes of the Old Stone Mill restaurant in Tuckahoe, New York, which is struggling to attract customers, leading to debts of nearly $1million. Gordon feels the owner is more interested in his own appearance than how his food tastes and a screaming match ensues.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E

programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts as team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson are joined by actor Henry Winkler, comedians Henning Wehn and Romesh Ranganathan, and Olympic swimmer Rebecca Adlington. As usual, the panellists discuss and dissect the events that have set the British public's chins wagging over the past week.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at the Angel Inn in Wangford, Suffolk, where husband-and-wife owners Peter and Christine hope to prove that their establishment offers the best value for money. However, a self-service breakfast fails to impress the guests, and Christine struggles to keep her cool as confusion reigns in the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second night of the competition moves to Moaps Farm in Dane Hill, East Sussex, where Lesley Miller hopes her guests will be charmed by her laid-back attitude. On arrival, the group is wowed by the view, but at breakfast the host's relaxed approach leads to disaster and some of her fellow B&B owners are forced to help out with the service.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: From Jabajak in Carmarthenshire, Wales, where sisters Lorraine Lloyd and Amanda Stuart-Robson host in their vineyard and restaurant B&B. The guests are stunned by the surroundings, and businessman Les Woollends and his head chef Lesz Zajac are convinced the sister act have the wow factor.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Les Woollends and his head chef Lesz Zajak welcome the contestants to the Clarendon Royal Hotel in Gravesend, Kent. The guests are dazzled on arrival, but Lesley Miller believes the champagne, truffles and fruit bowl are a ploy to win her over. The quality of the food gets good reviews at breakfast, although the guests poke fun at the crockery, and at feedback time criticism comes from an unexpected source and leaves the owner reconsidering his views of his rivals.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants featured throughout the week reunite to revisit the highs and lows of their various stays, and as the B&B owners confront their critics face to face, they discover what the rival parties really thought of the quality of service they encountered. After the deliberations are over, the winning guest house is announced.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps Ali Harris and Steve Ashby from Poole to fulfil their dream of retiring to Italy to run a very English B&B, with the couple having a budget of £100,000.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Single mother of four Helen Broomhead from Cheshire seeks the assistance of Jasmine Harman in finding a property in the Cinque Terre region of Italy, with a budget of £100,000.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: The team investigates acres of overgrown gardens surrounding Upton Castle in Pembrokeshire, the centre of a romantic mystery for owners Steve and Pru Barlow. The pair bought what looked like a medieval castle at the front and a Victorian mansion at the back, leaving the origins of the complex unclear. The group digs trenches to look for a courtyard, while building specialists crawl through the roof and an excavation for the remains of a drawbridge takes place. Presented by Tony Robinson.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Trial and Error: The Time Team Guide to Experimental Archaeology.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson celebrates the many practical experiments and re-creations that he and the team have conducted over 20 years to unlock the mysteries exposed by their digs. The programme revisits some memorable highlights from shows of yesteryear, from making individual objects like Stone Age axes, Roman pewter bowls, medieval pottery and King Arthur's sword, to building an entire Iron Age house and a Roman machine to lift water from a deep well.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Presenter Tim Shaw and master mechanic Fuzz Townshend head to Cambridge to rescue a cherished 1991 Range Rover Vogue SE, which is in need of some TLC.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of pioneering veterinary practice Fitzpatrick Referrals in Surrey, where orthopaedic-neuro veterinary surgeon Noel Fitzpatrick and his team help some of the nation's hardest-to-cure pets using cutting-edge procedures. A three-year-old Newfoundland dog needs surgery for its bent front legs, and a long-haired Chihuahua requires a total hip replacement. A woman brings in her German shepherd, which has developed a painful degenerative spinal disease requiring treatment.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Six years ago, Lucie Fairweather and Nat McBride embarked on a project to build an affordable eco-friendly family home in Woodbridge, Suffolk. However, just before they got started, Nat discovered he had cancer, and died a few months later. Lucie decided to carry on, and now Kevin McCloud returns to find out how her life has changed and if the striking property has settled into the landscape.(n)

programme.title: The Yorkshire Dales and the Lakes
programme.desc: John and William Dawson must gather in 2,000 sheep across a 3,500-acre expanse of the Dales, while in the Lakes, Trudy Harrison tries to turn round the village of Bootle's fortunes.(n)

programme.title: Hidden Britain by Drone
programme.desc: Tony Robinson presents the first of two programmes using drones to shoot aerial footage of areas of Britain that are off limits to the public. Among the locations featured is a village on Salisbury Plain that is not listed on any maps, and is used by the military for training. The drones record an exercise involving tanks storming the area. Other sites include the world's most advanced container port, a Second World War bunker, an abandoned airbase that once housed nuclear weapons, and an 18th-century mansion belonging to a Russian billionaire.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef again comes to the aid of failing American restaurants, starting in Fishtown, Philadelphia, where he tries to help the three owners of the Hot Potato Cafe, which has not made a profit in two years. Spurred on by a scathing review by an influential critic, he makes radical changes to alter the staff's attitudes and create food that is up to his own exacting standards.(n)

programme.desc: Man's Other Best Friend. Sometimes man's best friend is not what you may think. Sometimes it's a goose, a seal, or even a bear. That's right, there's the goose that warms the heart of an aging retiree in a Los Angeles Park, a seal who won't eat without her best friend - an Irish veterinarian, a boy who finds companionship with the normally dangerous cape buffalo, a deer who thinks a human couple and a cat make a herd, a sheep that thinks a house is a great home, and a grizzly bear who pals around with his best buddy.
